title: ['Application Support Analyst']
description:
["Computershare (ASX:CPU) is a global market leader in transfer agency and share registration, employee equity plans, proxy solicitation and stakeholder communications.


We also specialise in corporate trust, mortgage, bankruptcy, class action, utility and tax voucher administration, and a range of other diversified financial and governance services.
Computershare is represented in all major financial markets and has over 12,000 employees worldwide.

The role:

Computershare Technology Services (CTS) is seeking an Application Support Analyst experienced with VMS/Linux software to join them on a permanent full-time basis.

The Application Support team ensures efficiency and reliability of its Core system (SCRIP), and the delivery of application functionalities and infrastructure changes within the Oceania region. Our objective is to ensure adequate support is provided to all stakeholders to meet their strategic agendas.
Joining a close-knit team that requires liaison with all business units, direct clients and other technology teams, and provides exposure to complex environments and interfaces through issue diagnosis, application analysis, processing of requirements and some essential testing.

An understanding of the securities industry and an awareness of upcoming technologies will be an advantage in this role.


Flexibility:
This position requires that you are flexible with working hours and able to cover shifts on a rotating roster from 7am – 7pm with the 2 shifts being 7am – 3pm and 11am – 7pm. There will also be an on-call support component to this role with a rotating on call roster every 8 weeks.

Responsibilities Include:

Provide technical mentoring and guidance to clients
Respond to requests for technical assistance in person, via phone, electronically
Show initiative in reducing support queues
Diagnose the causes of items reported
Liaise with development teams to resolve software issues
Research questions using available information resources
Advise user on appropriate action
Log all request interactions
Redirect problems to appropriate resource
Identify and escalate situations requiring urgent attention
Track and route problems and requests and document resolutions
Stay current with system information, changes and updates
Ensure all relevant processes, documents, checklists and standards are adhered to in order to maximise quality.
Suggest ways to improve existing processes and/or create additional ones to improve quality and efficiency
To ensure your success in this role you will bring:

Extensive VMS/Linux Application knowledge
Relevant experience in the Financial/Share Registry sector
High degree of self-direction, initiative and motivation
Flexible approach to work, including hours
Ability to negotiate and influence others
Able to work under pressure and set priorities and deliver to tight deadlines/milestones
Ability to work with demanding stakeholders and develop strong working relationships
You must be an Australian Citizen or Permanent Resident to be considered for this role.

Keeping our employees safe
We're currently performing all interviews, assessments and background checks online to ensure the safety of everyone involved.


Most of our employees are working remotely. For people who need to be in the office we're following government guidelines on safe working. This includes regular cleaning, maintaining safe distances and limiting the number of people in the office at any one time.

We want every person who joins our team, every customer and every supplier to feel welcome. We see diversity as a source of strength - the more perspectives we have, the better equipped we’ll be to meet the demands of our diverse global customer base. We believe in equality for everyone, regardless of age, ethnicity, gender identity, race, religion, disability or sexual orientation.

| CERTAINTY | INGENUITY | ADVANTAGE |"]

title: ['Data Insights Analyst']
description:
['Is innovation part of your DNA? Do you want to enable a connected future for people, organizations, and society?

Join our growing global NTT team and you’ll be part of the world’s largest ICT company (by revenue). We’ve combined the capabilities of 28 remarkable companies to become one, leading technology services provider. Together, we help our people, clients, and communities do great things with technology to create a more secure and connected future. We employ 40,000 people across 57 countries. By bringing together the world’s best technology companies and emerging innovators, we work together to deliver sustainable outcomes to businesses and the world. Innovation is part of our DNA. We believe it’s key to what makes us different. So, we strive to move forward, challenge the status quo, and drive excellence through the technologies we integrate and the services we deliver around the world. The result is connected cities, connected factories, connected healthcare, connected agriculture, connected conservation, connected mobility, and connected sport. Together we enable the connected future.

Want to be part of the team?


We are seeking a Data Insights Analyst for our Melbourne office. This is a unique opportunity to join our passionate Data & Analytics team, using your experience in turning data into meaningful stories that will enable our customers to make effective data driven decisions.

Your day at NTT

Engage with users to design insight experiences that drives underlying business needs
Defining user requirements from low-fidelity sketches to high-fidelity mock-ups
Combining data, narrative and visuals to solve complex problems with meaningful insights
Using your design skills to collaborate with users to uncover hidden insights.
Designing and delivering insights to users through reporting tools


What would make you a good fit for this role?

Ability to combine visualisations and language to delivery effective insights to users
Experience in working in visualisation tools, such as PowerBI, to deliver insights into the business
Strong solutioning focus with an understanding of how data can be applied to resolve business problems
Effective communication skills and the ability to explain complex concepts to broader audiences.
Ability to communicating your concepts and ideas via storytelling
An understanding of design methodologies such as human centred design
Experience in SQL, Python and R desirable
Join NTT and shape your career with us.

Join our growing global team and accelerate your career with us. Apply today.

For more information about this or other opportunities, please contact Swapna Raghavan. Please quote our job reference number 476482.

About us

NTT Ltd. is a global ICT provider, employing more than 40,000 people in a diverse and dynamic workplace, and delivering services in over 200 countries and regions. We partner with organizations around the world to shape and achieve outcomes through intelligent technology solutions. For us, intelligent means data driven, connected, digital, and secure.

NTT is proud to be an equal opportunity employer with a global culture that embraces diversity. We are committed to providing an environment free of unfair discrimination and harassment. We do not discriminate based on age, race, color, sex, religion, national origin, disability, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, veteran status, or other protected category.']

title: ['Rating Analyst - Corporate']
description:
['The Role: Rating Analyst
You will be a critical member to the Corporates Ratings Team. You are responsible for analyzing individual company’s financial performance, competitive industry position and quality of management for analytical purposes. This analysis also includes sectors and market trends.
The Location: Melbourne/ Sydney

The Impact: You will be responsible for the development of spreadsheet statistics and databases and will be actively involved in developing rating committee presentations, portfolio reviews and commentaries.
The Team / The Business: You will be part of a global and multicultural team.

Your skills: Bachelor degree is required. You have in-depth knowledge of the financial and corporate industries. You have strong analytical and research skills.
Our Hiring Manager says: “I’m looking for the kind of person who is passionate to pursue a career in credit research. You will play a key role within the Analytical team assisting resolving client’s needs and assess client’s financial performance, projections and business plan.”
Responsibilities:
Collects economic and financial information specific to a commodity market or organization, conducts market sector or statistical analysis and interprets key market data elements into useful business information
Leverages broad scope of knowledge when performing analysis on data sets
Focuses on theory and concepts, applying quantitative or analytical skills to complete projects/studies/tasks
Conducts research including identifying data, data input, and statistical analysis of results and creates and maintains data and analysis reports
Works closely with senior analysts to ensure most recent information is updated in the financial model.
Support senior analysts to prepares presentations and participate the meetings with clients.
Requirements:
Bachelor degree in commerce, finance, accounting or related subjects
Pursuing CPA or CFA designation will be ideal
2 - 3 years of research or analytical experience with other financial institutions
Strong Excel and analytical skills to collate and analyze a wide range of information
Strong network and understanding of the Australian and New Zealand capital markets
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Good organization skills and very high attention to details
Good time management and prioritization; managing priorities while maintaining high standards; and to work in a team.
Candidates with less experience can be considered as Research Assistant
About S&P Global Ratings
S&P Global Ratings is the world’s leading provider of independent credit ratings. Our ratings are essential to driving growth, providing transparency and helping educate market participants so they can make decisions with confidence. We have more than 1 million credit ratings outstanding on government, corporate, financial sector and structured finance entities and securities. We offer an independent view of the market built on a unique combination of broad perspective and local insight. We provide our opinions and research about relative credit risk; market participants gain independent information to help support the growth of transparent, liquid debt markets worldwide.
S&P Global Ratings is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies and governments to make decisions with confidence. For more information, visit www.spglobal.com/ratings
S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer committed to making all employment decisions without regard to race/ethnicity, gender, pregnancy, gender identity or expression, color, creed, religion, national origin, age, disability, marital status (including domestic partnerships and civil unions), sexual orientation, military veteran status, unemployment status, or other legally protected categories, subject to applicable law.']

title: ['Test Analyst']
description:
['About the Role
An experienced test analyst you will join our project team on a 12 month contract, working to implement an Identity and Access Management solution aligned with Industry standards and trends and capable of supporting the delivery of services to meet member demand and value.
Your duties will include, but are not limited to:
Responsible for developing and executing tests
Discuss with Project team appropriate testing approaches to confirm functional requirements are appropriately tested
Identify and implement appropriate testing techniques on activities.
Ensure test plans and test cases are built in alignment with activity outcomes and executed in line with activity expectations.
Ensures test documentation is complete, providing visibility and assurance that testing activities have been completed.
About You:
As the successful candidate, you will bring the following experience to the role
Tertiary level qualification in information technology (IT), computer science, computer engineering, electrical engineering and/or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in the application of testing principles along with demonstrated use and application of these different techniques.
Solid analytical skills
Knowledge and understanding of some of the following technologies:
Microsoft Development Environment experience including Visual Studio/ Microsoft
ALM, Team Foundation Server, Microsoft Test Manager
XML, HTML and JavaScript
Database applications
Database technologies (MS, SQL)
Benefits of joining CPA

At CPA Australia people are at the heart of what we do. We promote and encourage an inclusive and diverse workplace where everyone can be their best.
CPA Australia Employee Benefits include:
Flexible working hours
Paid parental, volunteer and study leave
Annual incentive scheme
Discounts on health insurance, phone plans, fuel, banking and many more
Great Southbank location
Learning & Professional Development opportunities
Become part of a well-known global brand and make global connections
How do I Apply?
Click Apply Now to submit your application for this opportunity.
To learn more about CPA Australia and other opportunities, please visit our Careers page at https://www.cpaaustralia.com.au/about-us/careers .
Agencies please note: this vacancy is being managed directly by CPA Australia’s Recruitment team. We will contact our preferred agency partners should we require additional support. Thank you']

title: ['Help Desk Analyst']
description:
['The L.E.K. Information Technology Department is seeking a Help Desk Analyst to join the team. This position will report directly to the Help Desk Coordinator/Manager.
The Help Desk Analyst is an advocate for customer needs, applies understanding of technology to resolve undocumented issues, initiates communication among the team, assists teammates with project work and problem resolution, actively participates in task development during scrum kickoff meetings, administrates with supervision, and executes basic scripts.

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Troubleshooting of hardware and software issues handled courteously and expeditiously.
Answering and appropriately handling customer support requests via phone, e-mail, voice mail, and IM.
Updating and keeping our inventory accurate.
Assisting staff that is highly mobile and could be working out of many locations such as the office, the airport, their home, or various client sites.
Documenting, tracking, and monitoring all work item and resolution activity in the tracking system to ensure a timely resolution.
Escalating issues of a specialized complexity to subject matter experts when appropriate.
Participating in team projects that enhance the quality of service.
Supporting various devices such as laptops, tablets, and mobile phones running operating systems such as Windows, Mac OS, iOS, and Android.
Searching online for possible solutions when they aren’t documented in our knowledgebase and creating and updating knowledge articles in the IT Knowledgebase.
Providing off-hours support on a scheduled rotation.
Other IT related functions and projects as requested that are not limited to daily IT support.
Qualifications:
Technical Skills
Strong understanding of PCs, tablets, mobile phones, peripherals, and various operating systems including but not limited to Windows, Apple iOS, and Android.
Solid understanding of Active Directory, SharePoint, VPN and remote access clients, printers, and other peripherals.
Some experience with CRM, ERP, and Data Analytics software support
Work style
Excellent verbal and written communication skills with technical, non-technical staff, and end-users.
Excellent customer service, including empathic listening skills.
Solid self-starter with the ability to work in a team environment.
Excellent follow-up skills to see tasks through to resolution, and communicate problem status to end users such as notification of completion, notification of delay, and rationale.
Excellent organizational skills, prioritizing and managing multiple tasks
Solid ability to offer and accept feedback and constructive suggestions.
Strong ability to work independently.']

title: ['Test Analyst - Investments']
description:
["Be inspired everyday

At HESTA we’re a leading national superannuation fund dedicated to people working in health and community services – a growing sector of ordinary people doing extraordinary things, day in day out, right across Australia.

More than 860,000 Australians trust HESTA with their money. So together, we invest billions in savings globally. We're about creating brighter futures for our members. And, a better world for generations to come. Our focus is on helping our members enjoy a retirement they’ve worked hard for.

The opportunity

As the Test Analyst – Investments (12 month contract), you’ll play a key role in the Quality Assurance and Quality Control delivery of investment initiatives at HESTA. This role will be responsible for the creation and execution of test scenarios and cases relating to the delivery of two projects key to the achievement of HESTA’s strategic objectives – Investment Data Management and Portfolio Management System. These projects will be crucial in supporting the internalisation of investment management at HESTA and take our investment execution capability to a whole new level. In doing so you can expect to work closely with SMEs from various business areas in the delivery of other small to medium-sized projects, supporting business teams to deliver a quality assured release.

About you

ith a strong background in Test Analysis in financial services and a track record of working collaboratively with Business Analysts and Development teams across all stages of projects, you’ll be eager to use your expertise to help make a positive difference to every HESTA member’s financial future. ISTQB Certified and with financial services domain experience (mandatory) you’ll also ideally have strong exposure to Selenium, Gherkin and/or other QA tools as well as experience in using Jira and Confluence. Understanding of and experience in Software Development Life Cycles, including Waterfall and Agile approaches will also set you up for success.

What’s in it for you?

This role represents the chance to join a leading industry fund that offers a welcoming and supportive culture as well as unrivalled training and development opportunities. Other benefits include:

a competitive remuneration packageopportunities to grow your careersustainable and collaborative workspaces

HESTA is a great place to work. But don’t take our word for it: we were named (again!) Employer of Choice for Gender Equality 2019.

Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply.

Please note: Applications via recruitment agencies will not be accepted for this position."]

title: ['Acurity Test Analyst']
description:
['About Us:
UniSuper is one of Australia’s largest superannuation funds and is run solely for the benefit of its members. For more than 34 years, UniSuper has been managing super for people employed in the higher education and research sector. UniSuper currently invests around $85 billion on behalf of 450,000 current and former higher education and research employees.
The Opportunity:
We’re all here to help deliver greater retirement outcomes for our members. Your role supports UniSuper doing this by ensuring stability, availability and reliability of production platforms through planned testing whilst supporting key compliance projects.
In addition, you’ll be part of delivering quality application change across various platforms through analysis, planning, creation and execution of Test designs, cases and procedures
Key Responsibilities will include:
Design test scenarios in adherence with UniSuper testing framework, through the analysis and investigation of requirements, solution designs and process documentation
Structure test scenarios within a test suite that provides for timely completion of testing, appropriate test coverage, the capture of relevant and accurate test results
Create, execute, and maintain test cases relating to specific functional or technical requirements
Identify test data requirements in preparation for test execution
Skills Required:
Acurity experience a MUST
Extensive testing background within large complex environments
Extensive procedure and system knowledge
Strong Agile and Waterfall methodology experience
Demonstrable experience delivering effective and efficient functional testing on projects
Financial experience highly regarded
Ability to adapt to multiple testing tools and methodologies
What We Offer
A challenging, collaborative and fun culture. You will receive the support that you need to build your own career in a People team that is under new leadership and leading change across UniSuper.
You’ll also receive extra annual leave days between Christmas and New Year, access to a Wellness program, volunteer leave, generous superannuation contributions, gym discounts and support for flexibility. You can also access our Financial Advisers at a reduced rate to help you plan your financial future.']

title: ['Energy Market Reconciliation and Reporting Analyst']
description:
["There’s never been a better time to be at AGL
At AGL, we believe progress is powered by our people.
If you’re set on making real change for tomorrow, we have the scale, resources and ambition to get it started today.
Now’s an extraordinary time to work with us. We’re taking the lead on renewables and expanding our products to make them more sustainable, affordable and useful for all Australians.
That’s what we call progress. To achieve it, we’re bringing together people with unique stories, perspectives, backgrounds and talent – and we need yours too!
About the Role
Opportunity to support our Energy Markets Reconciliation Team
Excellent benefits, including discounted energy and telco plans
Flexible working
At AGL we have a passionate belief in progress for life – a relentless determination to make things better for our communities, the Australian economy, and our planet. We’re focused on delivering new, innovative and integrated offerings to meet the changing needs of our customers in an ever-changing energy environment. We believe in ‘actions, not words’, which not only drives the way we work together and for our customers, but also how we give back to local communities in meaningful ways.
Customer Markets is committed to AGL’s future growth by bringing our Purpose – Progress for life – alive for our customers, grow customer numbers and value, and support generation investment.
We have an exciting opportunity for you to join our Energy Markets Reconciliation Team within the Customer Markets division. The team ensures the accuracy of invoices and reduces the risk of overpayments and billing errors in accordance with the AGL risk strategy, relevant B2B procedures, jurisdictional time frames and regulatory and contractual requirements. Reporting to the Network Reconciliation Team Lead, the Reconciliation Analyst will be responsible to oversee, monitor and execute network and energy reconciliations and initiatives.
How you'd make an impact on our team?
Proactively work with wider teams to identify, analyse and develop processes to reduce overcharges of network and energy charges.
Focus on improvements which increase the percentage of reconciled items.
Perform effective 3-way reconciliation between energy, network and billing to ensure that AGL accurately pass through all applicable charges to customers.
Provide/Create accurate and timely reporting including trends, status updates and tracking of disputed items and recovery of overcharges.
Contribute towards the team revenue target by ensuring all incorrect charges are disputed.
What you’ll bring to the table:
Proven experience in a data driven role operating in a large business environment.
Ability to design, develop and create reports/dashboards using advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel, SQL and reporting tools like PowerBI, Tableau along with demonstrated attention to detail.
Ability to interpret and draw insights from large, complex and ambiguous data sets, communicate those insights appropriate to the audience needs and make evidence-based recommendations to inform decisions.
Strong analytical and visualisation skills to support strategic decision making to minimize revenue leakage.
Experience with process management, delivery of process improvement opportunities including working with an offshore function.
Ability to adapt well to change and have a pro-active approach to continuous improvement.
At AGL all employees are encouraged to be themselves and to bring their whole selves to work every day. We encourage applications from Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander people, people living with disability, culturally and linguistically diverse people and people of the LGBTQ+ community, including transgender, gender diverse, and intersex people. AGL has a commitment to maintain a diverse workforce, so welcomes the opportunity for applicants to share their lived experiences but recognises that some applicants may not wish to disclose, so that option is supported.
Please note - unsolicited resumes from agencies will not be accepted by AGL.
Job Family Group:
Billing and Credit Control - Group"]

title: ['ServiceNow Developer']
description:
["Reference: VG/DJ7748NOV
At the Department of Justice and Community Safety, we’re looking for people who want to make a difference. People who take pride in their work. People who get things done. People who are committed to making Victoria a safer place.

We embrace diversity and strive to have a workforce that reflects the community we serve. We’re all about recruiting the best people, regardless of gender, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation or cultural background. If you think you can do the job and would be a good fit for our department, we’d love to hear from you.

The department is committed to the safety and wellbeing of children and recognises that children’s rights need to be respected, their views welcomed and valued, and their concerns taken seriously and acted upon.

If you require adjustments to the recruitment and selection process, or require an alternative format to any of the application material, please don't hesitate to get in touch with the contact person listed on this ad.

For more information on working with us and our recruitment process, please visit justice.vic.gov.au/careers

We’re proud of the important work we do across Victoria. Want to be part of it?
About us

Technology Solutions (TS) provides a range of Information, Communication and Technology (ICT) services for the Department of Justice and Community Safety (DJCS). The branch sets the strategic direction of ICT in alignment with the business direction. TS is responsible for ICT strategies, initiatives, architectures, policies, projects, applications and infrastructure services in a multi-sourced environment.

About the role

As the ServiceNow Developer you will:

undertake the design and delivery of system or automation changes in collaboration with business stakeholders and designers, architects, analysts and testers using agile methodologies
provide subject matter advice in engineering and development, to the cross-functional teams ensuring departmental compliance and benefit realisation
contribute technical expertise and deliver IT processes including issue and problem management, incident resolution, automation, testing and agile story/task delivery.

About you

As our ideal candidate you will have:

knowledge and development experience on the ServiceNow platform and JavaScript
previous experience in DevOps tool sets, architectures and CI/CD
experience in development methodologies such as agile (Scrum, Kanban, Scrumban and Safe) and waterfall.

How to apply

Please click the Apply button on this advertisement. Applications should include a resume and cover letter. Attachments can be uploaded in .doc, .docx, .pdf, .txt or .rtf formats.

The successful candidate will be required to undergo pre-employment checks which may include national police checks and misconduct screening."]

title: ['Reporting Analyst']
description:
['Primary Location
Melbourne, VIC
Job Description Summary
Exciting opportunity to join our Technology & Continuous Improvement team as a Reporting Analyst
About the Role
Service Stream’s Telecommunications division are currently seeking a Reporting Analyst to join our Technology & Continuous Improvement team. Reporting directly to the Business Assurance & Reporting manager, you will be responsible for working collaboratively within Fixed Communications (business and technology stakeholders) to elicit, analyse, translate, and document business requirements into specifications that will allow for the development of BI reporting. Based in our Collins Street head office (VIC), and offered on a 6-month Max Term, Full Time basis, this position offers an excellent opportunity for the right candidate.
Key Responsibilities
Facilitate workshops between multiple business stake holders and SMEs in order to acquire and document solid business requirements
Liaise with key business users, IT and external suppliers in the development of reports
Develop strong and positive relationships with both internal and external customers
Assess delivered solutions for alignment with expected business outcomes
Ability to clearly document user requirements
Skills and Experience
Technical qualifications in SQL, Power BI, Microsoft SSRS and analytics (reporting, predictive, prescriptive)
Relevant experience and understanding of user needs of information and communication technologies and systems
Experience in conducting workshops to extract information and provide training
Experience and skills in presenting and pitching solutions (preferred)
Experience in the telecommunications and/or utilities industries (preferred)
Benefits
6-month, maximum term opportunity
Focus on reward & recognition
Supportive team culture
Department
GBIS
How to Apply
If this sounds like you apply now to the Service Stream']

title: ['Data Analyst']
description:
['Email : Jobs@Playsidestudios.com

Data Analyst

Overview:

We are looking for a data analyst to join our scaling team. Working on multiple apps and games over multiple networks you will be tasked on finding ways to improve our titles with data!

Primary Responsibilities:
Combine analytical skills and business acumen to provide the product team with the insights that will drive strategy.
Analyse data, edit concise and meaningful insights: find the signal in the noise that can drive new features or disclose news usages.
Set up and run app-specific A/B tests to drive KPI improvements and help decision making.
Play a key role in supporting the vision for business analytics and challenge the processes to recommend improved KPIs.
Work closely with product managers and data scientists in order to set up a top data team that can bring high added value to our products and businesses on the long run.
Required Skills:

Excellent analytical, problem solving skills including root cause analysis and data cleansing.
Comfortable to interact and work together technical teams
Willingness to learn data analysis and application development to provide optimal support.
Experience with data warehousing and BI platforms.
Advanced knowledge of Excel & experience of statistical analysis tools including, R, Python, SQL and any other programming language experience.
Ability to effectively communicate complex insights and structured hypothesis
Bonus Points:

2+ years of working experience.
Prior data analysis experience in a startup with a large user base
Experience in Apps or Games..
Track record with successful mobile games.']

title: ['Service Desk Support Analyst']
description:
['Job no: 500029
Work type: Full time
Location: East Melbourne
Categories: Information Technology

Convenient East Melbourne location, close to public transport
Great culture with fun, friendly team and supportive management
Excellent Not for Profit Salary Packaging Benefits


About the role

The Service Desk Support Analyst is the first point of contact to support staff and clients reporting issues, requesting information and access, or other services. The role is responsible for ensuring ICT queries or issues are captured, validated and triaged for further processing, ensuring that information is communicated to users through the appropriate channels.

Primarily providing level 1 and 2 service support, the role will support and own the escalation process for issues of greater magnitude or where higher-level skill sets or partners to the business are required. As technology changes so will the role of the Service Desk Support Analyst through supporting the latest IT approved applications available to staff.

Proactively identify and diagnose ICT related issues and problems
Provide ICT support and assistance by phone, email and/or using the service desk ticketing system
Help manage the deployment, configuration and security of desktop and mobile computing and peripheral devices
Identify repetitive issues as problems and support the problem management and resolution process
Assist with the compilation and management of ICT asset registers, and device lifecycle management


Skills & experience


Qualification in Information Technology or equivalent technical knowledge
Demonstrated knowledge of personal computer support e.g. troubleshooting, networking, hardware, software packages, printers, scanners etc.
Well-established customer service and communication skills; ability to explain procedures, provide information and liaise with clients, stakeholders and members of the public
Quick learner with the ability to troubleshoot problems on the go and use initiative to resolve technical problems
Strong time management skills with the ability to work under pressure and prioritise effectively in a high-pressure environment
Current valid Victorian driver’s license

An ITIL V3/V4 certification or previous experience in a service desk environment will be looked upon favourably.


Benefits

As an employee of VMCH you will be provided with ongoing personal and professional development, career pathways opportunities, a positive and supportive workplace culture and excellent salary packaging benefits.


About us

VMCH are a Catholic not-for-profit organisation, providing services including affordable housing, residential aged care, retirement living, community and disability services and specialist education to 7,600 people across Victoria. We operate in over 50 locations, have 2,600+ employees and over 600 volunteers maintaining our 24/7 service to vulnerable people across Victoria.


If you meet the above criteria and are passionate about making a positive difference in people’s lives, we would love to hear from you!


To work at VMCH, you will be required to supply proof of work rights, an Australian Criminal History Check, Evidence of 2020 Flu Vaccination and a Victorian Employee Working with Children Check. You may also be required to supply an International Police Check.

We do not accept unsolicited resumes, emails and phone calls from recruitment agencies.

Download the Position Description

Advertised: 19 Nov 2020 12:00 AM AUS Eastern Daylight Time
Applications close: 03 Dec 2020 11:30 PM AUS Eastern Daylight Time']

title: ['Policy Analyst']
description:
['The Policy Analyst provides authoritative advice and administration in a range of public sector governance areas including board and director roles and responsibilities, performance planning and reporting, risk management and the conduct of relevant statutory processes.
The position will suit a motivated and conscientious person who is interested in the responsible stewardship of public assets, and capable of developing and maintaining sound relationships with a range of internal and external stakeholders.
Specialist/Technical Expertise/Qualifications


Expertise arising from working in legislation and legal concepts, finance and/or risk management, or in board recruitment will be highly regarded.

This is a fixed term position for 12 months.
To be considered for this position, your application should include a supporting statement demonstrating that you meet the Key Selection Criteria detailed in the position description, including the Specialist/Technical Expertise/Qualifications and Knowledge and Skills sections.
For further information please refer to the attached position description.
Applications close at midnight on 18 November 2020

Other relevant information:
Preferred candidates will be required to undertake pre-employment screening, including a Declaration and Consent form and a National Police Check.
We are building an inclusive workplace to help realise the potential of our employees, embrace our differences, and apply our diverse thinking to innovation and delivering services to Victorian communities. All jobs can be worked flexibly and we encourage job applications from Aboriginal people, people with disabilities, young people and people from culturally diverse backgrounds.']

title: ['Analyst']
description:
["Job Description

Location: Melbourne | CBD

Job type: Full time

Organisation: Department of Transport

Salary: $86,558 - $98,210

Occupation: Policy

Reference: VG/80004923A

The Department of Transport brings together all transport modes to design, plan, build and operate Victoria's transport system. Our job is to further integrate the transport network and improve the delivery of services to Victorians for simpler, quicker and safer journeys that connect people and places and support Victoria's prosperity and liveability. We're excited to offer this opportunity for you to become part of the Department that delivers more choice, connections and confidence in our travel, ensuring the whole transport network works as one to deliver better services and outcomes.

Analyst

Annual Salary Range: $86,558 – $98,210 per annum, plus superannuation
Tenure: Ongoing
Employment Type: Full Time
Usual Work Location: Melbourne CBD (currently work from home)

About the Team

The Policy and Innovation Division drives future transport opportunities, legislative and policy reform, and imbed a deep understanding of the user and innovative technology.

About the Opportunity

This primary purpose of this role is to apply appropriate methodologies and analysis techniques as well as strong management of data collection suppliers to deliver robust measure of patronage, capacity utilisation, and travel behaviour.

Key Accountabilities:
Support with timely processing of data to produce regular metrics, such as public transport patronage data, while adhering to appropriate quality controls
Support with the development of new or existing products, including the ingestion of data from surveys, automatic passenger counters and data sources internal across the industry to yield better insights. This includes analysis, stakeholder engagement, quality control, and administration
Works collaboratively with colleagues to support reporting programs and identify trends and new insights
Works collaboratively with colleagues to procure and manage vendors
Works with integrity to maintain privacy obligations, quality control, and reliability of data products and analysis

About you:
Well-developed conceptual, analytical and problem-solving skills to interpret data and respond to business requirements
Sound understanding of statistics and comfortable working with data to produce meaningful insights
One or more programming language (R, SQL, Python, etc.) and ability to manipulate large datasets
Has sound project management skills and is organised in their approach to work
Able to express themselves clearly and articulate complex ideas both in writing and verbally
Is professional and personable in their conduct with colleagues and stakeholders
Is innovative in their approach to work and constantly looking for opportunities to improve processes and analyses

Desirable

Tertiary qualification in a relevant or a related discipline.

Culture and Benefits

The Department of Transport is committed to building a culture of developing our people to achieve great outcomes for the Victorian transport network. We are proud of our commitment to flexible work arrangements that support different ways of working, helping employees balance work and life.

How to Apply

Applications should include a resume addressing relevant skills and experience. Applications close 11.59pm on Tuesday, 1 December 2020.

For a confidential discussion regarding this opportunity please call Andrew Molloy, Manager Data Science on 03 8392 8756.

Preferred applicants may be subject to pre-employment checks. Information provided to the Department of Transport will be treated in the strictest confidence."]

title: ['Planning and Reporting Analyst']
description:
['About the role
The Planning and Reporting Analyst works within the Planning and Risk Management team and is responsible for developing and producing management reports to meet the requirements of managers and other users of reports. The role is also responsible for developing and implementing data analytics to identify and analyse exceptions, trends and other relevant insights into financial data to provide advice to senior management. The Finance and Risk team have established finance reporting, the successful applicant will improve user friendliness of extracting information from available data and will present it in a visually appealing way.
The Planning and Reporting Analyst also provides advice to Members of Parliament and electorate officers on their budget expenditure in accordance with the relevant legislation and guidelines. This role supports the Senior Budget and Risk Analyst with the State budget process and external reporting requirements.
About you
To be successful in this role you will have proven experience in using data analytics and reporting tools with large financial management systems, such as Oracle. You will have skills and experience in extracting and visually presenting useful trends from large datasets. You will have experience in using a diverse range of reporting tools and will be able to review our data, and suggest and implement relevant tools and programs to analyse and present data. You will have experience in coordinating projects with input from variety of stakeholders at different levels of the organisation.
Your ability to interpret and apply legislative requirements, including Accounting Standards and related financial legislations, will be a strength.
You are a strong communicator and demonstrate the ability to communicate with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Qualification or proven experience in data analytics is desirable.
Why join us?
The Parliament of Victoria is committed to providing employees with flexible working conditions to support our employees in balancing their work and life commitments. You may also be eligible for annual discounts on various personal utilities, including myki pass and private health insurance.
Your professional development is important to us, that's why we have a dedicated learning and development framework, along with leadership development programs and targeted in-house training.
Whether you're working in the iconic heritage listed Parliament House building or in our adjacent open-plan, modern offices you'll have easy access to public transport, Melbourne's top retailers, cafes and restaurants, along with other lifestyle attractions available on the unique Collins Street and Spring Street precincts.
How to Apply
Using the "Apply Now" button, please respond to our questions in the application, include your resume and brief cover letter (1-2 pages) broadly outlining your experience in line with the Key Selection Criteria contained within the position description']

title: ['Project Analyst, Engagement / Project Analyst, Operations']
description:
["
2 x Project Analyst roles available

About us
The Department of Justice and Community Safety is responsible for managing COVID-19 accommodation programs as part of Victoria's public health response to coronavirus.
The department is running three programs that support people to quarantine and self-isolate to help slow the spread of coronavirus in the community:


Mandatory quarantine for returned overseas travellers
Emergency accommodation for community residents
Frontline worker accommodation

The Victorian Chief Health Officer has mandated that all returning overseas travellers arriving in Victoria must go into mandatory quarantine for 14 days from the day of their arrival to help slow the spread of coronavirus.
Emergency accommodation is available to people in Victoria who need support to quarantine or self-isolate safely because they have been diagnosed with coronavirus or are a close contact of a person with coronavirus.
Frontline worker accommodation is available for workers leading the public health and safety response to coronavirus who need support to quarantine or self-isolate safely.
Infection control and prevention is the primary objective of the mandatory quarantine and emergency accommodation programs.
About the roles
The Project Analyst, Operations and the Project Analyst, Engagement will work in the ‘Compliance and Enforcement' team and will report to Senior Project Officers.

As the Project Analyst, Operations, you will:

review and maintain the operational procedures supporting Compliance and Enforcement (C&E) operations in accordance with clear governance and version control processes
conduct accurate record keeping and reporting in accordance with the operational procedure management framework
work with Quality and Performance to ensure trends in performance and quality are reflected in updated operating procedures and training for C&E staff.

As the Project Analyst, Engagement, you will:

undertake comprehensive consultation and liaison to gather information, advice and views on identified issues, providing analysis, reports and recommendations to more senior staff
work with the Compliance Engagement to support timely communication of relevant operational information across compliance and enforcement operations
use targeted and agreed communication channels to generate, review and distribute important and comprehensive updates in relation to processes and systems, organisational change and other role crucial material.

To learn more about these roles before applying, please read the attached position descriptions.
About you

Applicable to both roles, our ideal candidate will have:

the ability to write clearly and effectively for different purposes
demonstrated ability to synthesise information from various sources.

A tertiary qualification in a relevant discipline would be advantageous.
How to apply
Please click the Apply button on this advertisement. Applications should include a resume and cover letter. Attachments can be uploaded in .doc, .docx, .pdf, .txt or .rtf formats.
The successful candidate will be required to undergo pre-employment checks which may include national police checks and misconduct screening."]

title: ['Allocation Analyst Opportunities']
description:
['Work is a whole lot better when you love what you do, we know that. That’s why we make sure that the loves and interests of our people match their responsibilities. We take what they love, and we let them live it.
So, do you want to be part of a team who loves coming to work each day? A team that makes Myer a great place to shop, and an even greater place to work?

We are seeking expressions of interest for highly motivated individuals to take the next step in their career and become Allocation Analysts in our Merchandise Planning teams at Myer.

It is an exciting time to join, the Planning team is experiencing a huge transformation with the team introducing the Planning Academy which offers career opportunities and development. If you're good with numbers and are excited by data and love working in fashion, then this is a career for you!

Current opportunities within various departments
Further scope for succession planning and development
Make your mark in your chosen category!

About the role:

Manage the order raising and allocation process to ensure Myer and supplier lead times are achieved
Ensure optimal store allocation of orders based on detailed analysis
Understand all aspects of supply chain and conduct reporting and analysis on in-season sales performance
Support the Analysis & Planning Manager and Buyer in preparing assortment plans, post-season analysis, stock transfers and markdowns
Scope for career development into Merchandise leadership roles

About you:

Detailed understanding of the allocations process in a retail environment and exceptional analytical skills, ideally gained in a similar role
Strong negotiation and influencing skills to enable effective decisions to be made in relation to the allocation of merchandise
Excellent interpersonal skills, including written and verbal communication
Strong data accuracy skills and attention to detail will be critical to success in this role
Good understanding of supply chain processes, including lead times, supplier requirements and overseas process
Excellent time management skills with the ability to work independently on prioritising and meeting deadlines

Benefits to you:

A great working environment and flexible working options
Generous discounts on all Myer products
Invitations to attend Myer's Sample Sales
A great sense of job satisfaction for your dedication and work ethic
Career succession planning and opportunities for growth & development

Your application will be kept on file and we will be in contact should a suitable position matching your application become available. Please note that all Allocation Analyst positions are permanent full time positions (Monday – Friday) and are located at the Myer Support Office in Docklands, Victoria.

To register your interest, please click on the "Apply" button below.
Aust. Working Rights: To be eligible to apply for this job, you must have Australian working rights. For further information contact the Australian Department of Immigration.

Equal Opp. Employer: We pride ourselves on the diversity of the people who work at Myer, representing the community in which we serve.

Agency note: Myer Pty Ltd does not accept unsolicited resumes/candidate profiles from external agencies or suppliers via any method. Any candidates submitted in an unsolicited manner, will be considered a direct candidate application to Myer and no fee will be payable.']

title: ['Business Analyst (2 positions)']
description:
['The Business Analyst role is a key member of the Financial Management team, providing expert financial advice and information. The Business Analyst will provide support to a Divisional Business Manager and the core business activities of divisions within the Energy Group.
Success in the role requires the incumbent to be well organised, have a high level of attention to detail, be excellent in developing relationships and have a service orientation that helps the Groups report quality information on a timely basis.
Specialist/Technical Expertise/Qualifications


An appropriate business, accounting or finance related qualification is desirable.

These are fixed term positions until 30 June 2021 and 6 September 2021.
To be considered for this position, your application should include a supporting statement demonstrating that you meet the Key Selection Criteria detailed in the position description, including the Specialist/Technical Expertise/Qualifications and Knowledge and Skills sections.
For further information please refer to the attached position description.
Applications close at midnight on Thursday 3 December 2020.

Other relevant information:
Preferred candidates will be required to undertake pre-employment screening, including a Declaration and Consent form and a National Police Check.
We are building an inclusive workplace to help realise the potential of our employees, embrace our differences, and apply our diverse thinking to innovation and delivering services to Victorian communities. All jobs can be worked flexibly, and we encourage job applications from Aboriginal people, people with disabilities, young people and people from culturally diverse backgrounds.

For further information including the position description, key selection criteria and to apply visit
www.careers.vic.gov.au']

title: ['Investment Analyst - Listed Assets']
description:
["Be inspired everyday

At HESTA we’re dedicated to people working in health and community services – a growing sector of ordinary people doing extraordinary things, day in day out, right across Australia.
More than 870,000 Australians trust HESTA with their money. So together, we invest billions of savings globally. We're about creating brighter futures for our members. And, a better world for generations to come. Our focus is on helping our members enjoy a retirement they’ve worked hard for.

The opportunity

Are you looking for a new challenge? We are on the lookout for high calibre talent as our Investments team is growing again! We have a fantastic opportunity for an Investment Analyst to join our team in Melbourne, someone who has a long horizon mind-set and commercial acumen. This role will focus on supporting the Investment Managers in the listed asset exposure, in particular, listed equities, currency, fixed interest and cash.

In this role, will have the opportunity to work across a multidisciplinary team assisting the Investment Managers with research and analysis to support the ongoing effective management of the portfolio to facilitate investment decisions that improve the expected risk and/or return profile of the portfolio.

We’re looking for someone with an aptitude and interest in qualitative and quantitative analytics with some experience in financial modelling, investment analytics, and risk analysis.
Having commenced your career in superannuation, funds management, asset consulting, or banking, experience in financial modelling and research including data management and coding will be highly regarded.

You will display strong written and verbal communications skills as well as proven analytical skills. You will be tertiary qualified in a relevant business degree and working towards a CFA/Master of Finance will be looked upon favourably.

What’s in it for you?
Access to great benefits, including a supportive environment, ongoing professional development, generous employer contributions and a market competitive total remuneration package
Be part of an ambitious, innovative and inclusive culture, whilst being coached and supported by experienced leaders who genuinely care about their team.
Opportunities to develop new skills and grow your career
Join one of the largest and fastest growing superannuation funds


HESTA is a great place to learn and grow your career. But don't just take our word for it, we were named (again!) Employer of Choice for Gender Equality 2020.
Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply."]

title: ['Application Support Analyst']
description:
["Computershare (ASX:CPU) is a global market leader in transfer agency and share registration, employee equity plans, proxy solicitation and stakeholder communications.


We also specialise in corporate trust, mortgage, bankruptcy, class action, utility and tax voucher administration, and a range of other diversified financial and governance services.
Computershare is represented in all major financial markets and has over 12,000 employees worldwide.

The role:

Computershare Technology Services (CTS) is seeking an Application Support Analyst experienced with VMS/Linux software to join them on a permanent full-time basis.

The Application Support team ensures efficiency and reliability of its Core system (SCRIP), and the delivery of application functionalities and infrastructure changes within the Oceania region. Our objective is to ensure adequate support is provided to all stakeholders to meet their strategic agendas.
Joining a close-knit team that requires liaison with all business units, direct clients and other technology teams, and provides exposure to complex environments and interfaces through issue diagnosis, application analysis, processing of requirements and some essential testing.

An understanding of the securities industry and an awareness of upcoming technologies will be an advantage in this role.


Flexibility:
This position requires that you are flexible with working hours and able to cover shifts on a rotating roster from 7am – 7pm with the 2 shifts being 7am – 3pm and 11am – 7pm. There will also be an on-call support component to this role with a rotating on call roster every 8 weeks.

Responsibilities Include:

Provide technical mentoring and guidance to clients
Respond to requests for technical assistance in person, via phone, electronically
Show initiative in reducing support queues
Diagnose the causes of items reported
Liaise with development teams to resolve software issues
Research questions using available information resources
Advise user on appropriate action
Log all request interactions
Redirect problems to appropriate resource
Identify and escalate situations requiring urgent attention
Track and route problems and requests and document resolutions
Stay current with system information, changes and updates
Ensure all relevant processes, documents, checklists and standards are adhered to in order to maximise quality.
Suggest ways to improve existing processes and/or create additional ones to improve quality and efficiency
To ensure your success in this role you will bring:

Extensive VMS/Linux Application knowledge
Relevant experience in the Financial/Share Registry sector
High degree of self-direction, initiative and motivation
Flexible approach to work, including hours
Ability to negotiate and influence others
Able to work under pressure and set priorities and deliver to tight deadlines/milestones
Ability to work with demanding stakeholders and develop strong working relationships
You must be an Australian Citizen or Permanent Resident to be considered for this role.

Keeping our employees safe
We're currently performing all interviews, assessments and background checks online to ensure the safety of everyone involved.


Most of our employees are working remotely. For people who need to be in the office we're following government guidelines on safe working. This includes regular cleaning, maintaining safe distances and limiting the number of people in the office at any one time.

We want every person who joins our team, every customer and every supplier to feel welcome. We see diversity as a source of strength - the more perspectives we have, the better equipped we’ll be to meet the demands of our diverse global customer base. We believe in equality for everyone, regardless of age, ethnicity, gender identity, race, religion, disability or sexual orientation.

| CERTAINTY | INGENUITY | ADVANTAGE |"]

title: ['Data Insights Analyst']
description:
['Is innovation part of your DNA? Do you want to enable a connected future for people, organizations, and society?

Join our growing global NTT team and you’ll be part of the world’s largest ICT company (by revenue). We’ve combined the capabilities of 28 remarkable companies to become one, leading technology services provider. Together, we help our people, clients, and communities do great things with technology to create a more secure and connected future. We employ 40,000 people across 57 countries. By bringing together the world’s best technology companies and emerging innovators, we work together to deliver sustainable outcomes to businesses and the world. Innovation is part of our DNA. We believe it’s key to what makes us different. So, we strive to move forward, challenge the status quo, and drive excellence through the technologies we integrate and the services we deliver around the world. The result is connected cities, connected factories, connected healthcare, connected agriculture, connected conservation, connected mobility, and connected sport. Together we enable the connected future.

Want to be part of the team?


We are seeking a Data Insights Analyst for our Melbourne office. This is a unique opportunity to join our passionate Data & Analytics team, using your experience in turning data into meaningful stories that will enable our customers to make effective data driven decisions.

Your day at NTT

Engage with users to design insight experiences that drives underlying business needs
Defining user requirements from low-fidelity sketches to high-fidelity mock-ups
Combining data, narrative and visuals to solve complex problems with meaningful insights
Using your design skills to collaborate with users to uncover hidden insights.
Designing and delivering insights to users through reporting tools


What would make you a good fit for this role?

Ability to combine visualisations and language to delivery effective insights to users
Experience in working in visualisation tools, such as PowerBI, to deliver insights into the business
Strong solutioning focus with an understanding of how data can be applied to resolve business problems
Effective communication skills and the ability to explain complex concepts to broader audiences.
Ability to communicating your concepts and ideas via storytelling
An understanding of design methodologies such as human centred design
Experience in SQL, Python and R desirable
Join NTT and shape your career with us.

Join our growing global team and accelerate your career with us. Apply today.

For more information about this or other opportunities, please contact Swapna Raghavan. Please quote our job reference number 476482.

About us

NTT Ltd. is a global ICT provider, employing more than 40,000 people in a diverse and dynamic workplace, and delivering services in over 200 countries and regions. We partner with organizations around the world to shape and achieve outcomes through intelligent technology solutions. For us, intelligent means data driven, connected, digital, and secure.

NTT is proud to be an equal opportunity employer with a global culture that embraces diversity. We are committed to providing an environment free of unfair discrimination and harassment. We do not discriminate based on age, race, color, sex, religion, national origin, disability, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, veteran status, or other protected category.']

title: ['Rating Analyst - Corporate']
description:
['The Role: Rating Analyst
You will be a critical member to the Corporates Ratings Team. You are responsible for analyzing individual company’s financial performance, competitive industry position and quality of management for analytical purposes. This analysis also includes sectors and market trends.
The Location: Melbourne/ Sydney

The Impact: You will be responsible for the development of spreadsheet statistics and databases and will be actively involved in developing rating committee presentations, portfolio reviews and commentaries.
The Team / The Business: You will be part of a global and multicultural team.

Your skills: Bachelor degree is required. You have in-depth knowledge of the financial and corporate industries. You have strong analytical and research skills.
Our Hiring Manager says: “I’m looking for the kind of person who is passionate to pursue a career in credit research. You will play a key role within the Analytical team assisting resolving client’s needs and assess client’s financial performance, projections and business plan.”
Responsibilities:
Collects economic and financial information specific to a commodity market or organization, conducts market sector or statistical analysis and interprets key market data elements into useful business information
Leverages broad scope of knowledge when performing analysis on data sets
Focuses on theory and concepts, applying quantitative or analytical skills to complete projects/studies/tasks
Conducts research including identifying data, data input, and statistical analysis of results and creates and maintains data and analysis reports
Works closely with senior analysts to ensure most recent information is updated in the financial model.
Support senior analysts to prepares presentations and participate the meetings with clients.
Requirements:
Bachelor degree in commerce, finance, accounting or related subjects
Pursuing CPA or CFA designation will be ideal
2 - 3 years of research or analytical experience with other financial institutions
Strong Excel and analytical skills to collate and analyze a wide range of information
Strong network and understanding of the Australian and New Zealand capital markets
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Good organization skills and very high attention to details
Good time management and prioritization; managing priorities while maintaining high standards; and to work in a team.
Candidates with less experience can be considered as Research Assistant
About S&P Global Ratings
S&P Global Ratings is the world’s leading provider of independent credit ratings. Our ratings are essential to driving growth, providing transparency and helping educate market participants so they can make decisions with confidence. We have more than 1 million credit ratings outstanding on government, corporate, financial sector and structured finance entities and securities. We offer an independent view of the market built on a unique combination of broad perspective and local insight. We provide our opinions and research about relative credit risk; market participants gain independent information to help support the growth of transparent, liquid debt markets worldwide.
S&P Global Ratings is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies and governments to make decisions with confidence. For more information, visit www.spglobal.com/ratings
S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer committed to making all employment decisions without regard to race/ethnicity, gender, pregnancy, gender identity or expression, color, creed, religion, national origin, age, disability, marital status (including domestic partnerships and civil unions), sexual orientation, military veteran status, unemployment status, or other legally protected categories, subject to applicable law.']

title: ['Test Analyst']
description:
['About the Role
An experienced test analyst you will join our project team on a 12 month contract, working to implement an Identity and Access Management solution aligned with Industry standards and trends and capable of supporting the delivery of services to meet member demand and value.
Your duties will include, but are not limited to:
Responsible for developing and executing tests
Discuss with Project team appropriate testing approaches to confirm functional requirements are appropriately tested
Identify and implement appropriate testing techniques on activities.
Ensure test plans and test cases are built in alignment with activity outcomes and executed in line with activity expectations.
Ensures test documentation is complete, providing visibility and assurance that testing activities have been completed.
About You:
As the successful candidate, you will bring the following experience to the role
Tertiary level qualification in information technology (IT), computer science, computer engineering, electrical engineering and/or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in the application of testing principles along with demonstrated use and application of these different techniques.
Solid analytical skills
Knowledge and understanding of some of the following technologies:
Microsoft Development Environment experience including Visual Studio/ Microsoft
ALM, Team Foundation Server, Microsoft Test Manager
XML, HTML and JavaScript
Database applications
Database technologies (MS, SQL)
Benefits of joining CPA

At CPA Australia people are at the heart of what we do. We promote and encourage an inclusive and diverse workplace where everyone can be their best.
CPA Australia Employee Benefits include:
Flexible working hours
Paid parental, volunteer and study leave
Annual incentive scheme
Discounts on health insurance, phone plans, fuel, banking and many more
Great Southbank location
Learning & Professional Development opportunities
Become part of a well-known global brand and make global connections
How do I Apply?
Click Apply Now to submit your application for this opportunity.
To learn more about CPA Australia and other opportunities, please visit our Careers page at https://www.cpaaustralia.com.au/about-us/careers .
Agencies please note: this vacancy is being managed directly by CPA Australia’s Recruitment team. We will contact our preferred agency partners should we require additional support. Thank you']

title: ['Help Desk Analyst']
description:
['The L.E.K. Information Technology Department is seeking a Help Desk Analyst to join the team. This position will report directly to the Help Desk Coordinator/Manager.
The Help Desk Analyst is an advocate for customer needs, applies understanding of technology to resolve undocumented issues, initiates communication among the team, assists teammates with project work and problem resolution, actively participates in task development during scrum kickoff meetings, administrates with supervision, and executes basic scripts.

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Troubleshooting of hardware and software issues handled courteously and expeditiously.
Answering and appropriately handling customer support requests via phone, e-mail, voice mail, and IM.
Updating and keeping our inventory accurate.
Assisting staff that is highly mobile and could be working out of many locations such as the office, the airport, their home, or various client sites.
Documenting, tracking, and monitoring all work item and resolution activity in the tracking system to ensure a timely resolution.
Escalating issues of a specialized complexity to subject matter experts when appropriate.
Participating in team projects that enhance the quality of service.
Supporting various devices such as laptops, tablets, and mobile phones running operating systems such as Windows, Mac OS, iOS, and Android.
Searching online for possible solutions when they aren’t documented in our knowledgebase and creating and updating knowledge articles in the IT Knowledgebase.
Providing off-hours support on a scheduled rotation.
Other IT related functions and projects as requested that are not limited to daily IT support.
Qualifications:
Technical Skills
Strong understanding of PCs, tablets, mobile phones, peripherals, and various operating systems including but not limited to Windows, Apple iOS, and Android.
Solid understanding of Active Directory, SharePoint, VPN and remote access clients, printers, and other peripherals.
Some experience with CRM, ERP, and Data Analytics software support
Work style
Excellent verbal and written communication skills with technical, non-technical staff, and end-users.
Excellent customer service, including empathic listening skills.
Solid self-starter with the ability to work in a team environment.
Excellent follow-up skills to see tasks through to resolution, and communicate problem status to end users such as notification of completion, notification of delay, and rationale.
Excellent organizational skills, prioritizing and managing multiple tasks
Solid ability to offer and accept feedback and constructive suggestions.
Strong ability to work independently.']

title: ['Test Analyst - Investments']
description:
["Be inspired everyday

At HESTA we’re a leading national superannuation fund dedicated to people working in health and community services – a growing sector of ordinary people doing extraordinary things, day in day out, right across Australia.

More than 860,000 Australians trust HESTA with their money. So together, we invest billions in savings globally. We're about creating brighter futures for our members. And, a better world for generations to come. Our focus is on helping our members enjoy a retirement they’ve worked hard for.

The opportunity

As the Test Analyst – Investments (12 month contract), you’ll play a key role in the Quality Assurance and Quality Control delivery of investment initiatives at HESTA. This role will be responsible for the creation and execution of test scenarios and cases relating to the delivery of two projects key to the achievement of HESTA’s strategic objectives – Investment Data Management and Portfolio Management System. These projects will be crucial in supporting the internalisation of investment management at HESTA and take our investment execution capability to a whole new level. In doing so you can expect to work closely with SMEs from various business areas in the delivery of other small to medium-sized projects, supporting business teams to deliver a quality assured release.

About you

ith a strong background in Test Analysis in financial services and a track record of working collaboratively with Business Analysts and Development teams across all stages of projects, you’ll be eager to use your expertise to help make a positive difference to every HESTA member’s financial future. ISTQB Certified and with financial services domain experience (mandatory) you’ll also ideally have strong exposure to Selenium, Gherkin and/or other QA tools as well as experience in using Jira and Confluence. Understanding of and experience in Software Development Life Cycles, including Waterfall and Agile approaches will also set you up for success.

What’s in it for you?

This role represents the chance to join a leading industry fund that offers a welcoming and supportive culture as well as unrivalled training and development opportunities. Other benefits include:

a competitive remuneration packageopportunities to grow your careersustainable and collaborative workspaces

HESTA is a great place to work. But don’t take our word for it: we were named (again!) Employer of Choice for Gender Equality 2019.

Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply.

Please note: Applications via recruitment agencies will not be accepted for this position."]
