title: ['Business Analyst']
description:
["Location: Melbourne, VIC, AU
Company: metrotrain
Metro is a multi-award winning organisation, and we pride ourselves on our team of honest, high performing professionals who are talented, inclusive and safety focused and who are at the core of our success. You will be joining an organisation that is known as a global leader in its field but also prides itself on being dynamic, embracing new technologies and focused on customer service. Our aim is to promote work/life balance, allow team members to bring their best to work and to truly be focused on a common goal which is to provide a world-class railway service.

Position
Establishing the business improvement initiatives by collaborating with the Compliance and Reporting Manager. The Business Analyst will be a crucial member of the OCMS team by helping the business deliver our commercial obligations to state.

This opportunity is likely to extend after 12 months if someone who has proven knowledge across systems, processes and change to helpdevelop and drive solutions across OCMS relating to State compliance and reporting activities.

Responsibilities

Investigate business requirements using a range of tools and techniques including interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, scenarios, business analysis and task/workflow analysis.
Familiarise with enterprise asset and financial management systems with ability to extract and analyse information to support systematic change and associated reporting.
Identify and interview relevant stakeholders who may have an interest in, or may be affected by, the problem or solution; complete stakeholder impact analyses; facilitate group workshops where necessary.
Collaborate with developers and subject matter experts to establish the business and technical solution designs (including to-be business processes), bearing in mind trade-offs between usability, performance and time/cost to deliver.
Facilitate open communication and discussion between stakeholders, using feedback to assess and promote understanding of the need for future changes in services, products and systems. Act as liaison between the Business Units, technology teams and support teams.
Develop and execute change and communications strategies and plans
Successfully engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously.
Plan and facilitate project workshops – e.g. problem definition, stakeholder analysis, risk analysis, implementation planning, etc.
Develop a deep understanding of the MTM organisational context, structure and operation.
Analyse business needs of a more strategic/complex nature, requiring a deeper understanding of MTM and with significant impact across the organisation.
Provide business analysis “practice leadership” in terms of coaching and mentoring other business analysts; contributing to improving business analysis processes, tools and templates, QA of other business analysts’ work as required, etc.
Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, deconstruct complex information into more easily accessible details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs.


About You

A relevant postgraduate qualification with 5+ years’ relevant experience, or an equivalent combination of relevant experience and/or education/training
Demonstrated extensive ability to identify and assess stakeholders needs, support and best approach to engage strategically to achieve project goals and objectives
Experience in supervising and managing staff through effective leadership and managing performance at a team level
Demonstrated ability to promote best practice through mentoring, coaching of other business analysts
Benefits
All Metro Employees receive a free Myki pass that allows free Public Transport in Victoria
Metro supports work/life balance with opportunities to work from home on occasion
Have a great impact on programs that will directly improve Melbourne’s suburban rail network whilst ensuring these developments do not come as a cost to our safe and cost-effective delivery of services


How to apply
Please submit your application by clicking ‘Apply Now’ before 4th December 2020

Metro Trains is an equal opportunity employer and embraces diversity. We encourage all interested applicants to apply but please note only applications with the right to live and work in Australia will be considered for this position.


This is a fantastic opportunity to build on the career you've developed to date and take it to the next level by making a tangible impact that matters.
If what you’ve read resonates with your values, experience and career aspiration then we want to hear from you!

Metro Trains is an equal opportunity employer and embraces diversity. We encourage all interested applicants to apply but please do note only applications with the right to live and work in Australia will be considered for this position."]

title: ['Data Analyst']
description:
["Requisition Title -
Data Analyst
Job Number: - AUS121205
Description

Senior Data Analyst/Pricing Manager
Role Location: Melbourne
Role Type: Data Analyst permanent
At ANZ our purpose is to shape a world where people and communities thrive and to achieve this, we need a talented Senior Data Analyst to join our Payments and Merchant Tribe. The Payments and Merchant Tribe's mission is to enable customers to pay and get paid more simply, reliably and cost-effectively.
Our data analysts deeply understand the power of data to generate quality customer insights, manage information and identify trends to accelerate sound business decisions.
Your skillset will enable you to source and interrogate data, working with a focus on the future, with an active understanding of industry trends to ensure capability development is aligned. You will influence strategic direction by translating insights into practical business recommendations, communicating team objectives and presenting data in digestible, logical and compelling ways.
This is a critical role within Payments & Merchant Services Tribe will have key responsibilities including:
Analysis and implementation of pricing changes in-line with scheme mandates and other strategic initiatives.
Develop understanding of merchant acquiring pricing structures and landscape.
Development of forecasting reports, models and insights to demonstrate portfolio impact of various pricing strategy and changes.
Data analysis and insights development to support all other strategic pricing, merchant and BAU initiatives.
Design and development of capabilities and tools to support the tribe with data and insights to enable agile and rapid response to merchant and pricing initiatives.
Provide input and assist in systems design, development and testing for business initiatives.
Support and assist with data analysis and data extract requests across the tribe.
Promote portfolio pricing standards and pricing opportunities with stakeholders.

What will your day look like?
Analyse, review and implement pricing changes and ensuring the integrity and accuracy of data.
Leverage data sets and develop insights to support various merchant acquisition, attrition and pricing initiatives.
Ensuring adherence to ANZ legal, regulatory and other external compliance obligations through data and insights.
Supporting business initiatives by providing input and support to system design and testing.
Design and develop processes, tools and capabilities to mitigate and eliminate operational risks.
Presenting data and insights to the broader team and tribe to enable data-driven decision making.

What will be in your toolkit?
Advanced skills in SQL (Oracle PL/SQL, Teradata) and Excel
Strong communication skills and adept at providing insights in business-friendly language.
Domain experience in pricing and/or merchant acquiring preferable.
Familiarity with data visualisation/business intelligence tools (QlikSense) will be advantageous.
Demonstrate a strong sense of accountability and attention to detail in delivering the outcome required by business.
Ability to take a consultative approach in working with multiple stakeholders across various ANZ teams.

About ANZ
We’re reinventing the way we do banking, and our community of collaborative, innovative thinkers who create human centred solutions are helping us get there. We’re responding faster to changing customer requirements, focusing on the things that matter and helping people achieve incredible things – be it buying their home, building a business or saving for things big or small.
We support our people by providing a range of flexible working options so they can work in the way that best suits them. We encourage you to talk to us about your need for flexibility and any adjustments you may require to our recruitment process or the role itself.
We’ll also offer you the opportunity to develop your career, working in a diverse and inclusive workplace where the different backgrounds, perspectives and life experiences of our people are celebrated and create a great place to grow, thrive and belong.
Interested in joining us? Click Apply now, or visit www.anz.com/careers to find out more or view other opportunities.
Reference number: AUS121205

#GD 4.2"]

title: ['Data Insights Analyst']
description:
['Join the world leader in legal automation and legal innovation
Come help us challenge the status-quo
Simplify our metrics, help us dig into our data to deliver actionable insights


The Role:


The Data Insights Analyst manages and coordinates the activities to support data-driven decisions made by Plexus. You are the owner of the data layer ensuring the key metrics that drive growth are simple and that each team has access to these metrics on demand and has integrity.


You will have a passion and curiosity for developing, interpreting, and generating business insights to support the Plexus team in delivering 100% year on year growth.


You will work with teams to simplify the metrics and build beautiful visualizations of key metrics using Power BI and associated tools. As this is a new capability for the organisation you will need to drive the architecture of the data ecosystem and toolset selection.

In more detail you will:
Support the Plexus leaders to develop and simplify the key metrics that drive growth
Define the governance structure for data and work with stakeholders to define metrics and map business logic
Develop data models to report on key metrics to deliver insights and incorporate predictive analysis to support growth
Analyse data and provide internal and external customers with clearly communicated insights
Visualise beautiful dashboards using Power BI.
Think outside the current reporting and process. Leverage the existing or new tools to deliver innovative solutions
Create plans to extend and develop insights and observations. i.e. Challenge convention with data
Learn new methods, techniques and advocate for new tools and explain the benefits to the team / business
Desired Outcomes:
Create and manage a simple set of north star metrics for the business along with sub metrics for each team & product line
Create and manage our data governance framework incorporating data models with clear definitions agreed for each metric
Build beautiful reports/dashboards generated for Plexus and each of the teams
Establish a data partnering model with key stakeholders
Generate actionable insights and present to Senior Leadership Team
Create roadmap for data insights capability
Key Capabilities:
Build data models and reports
Experience in Power BI/Power Pivot
Visualization and storytelling skills
SAAS or Product business preferred
Data governance
Stakeholder management
Business Analysis
Best practice techniques
Core Attributes:
Curious
Storytelling
Pragmatic
Problem-solving ability
Systematic and logical
Passion for learning
Commercial acumen']

title: ['Commercial Analyst - Consumer Goods']
description:
["Job no: 745084
Work type: Full time
Location: Melbourne - Metro West
Applications close: 18 Dec 2020 11:55 PM AUS Eastern Daylight Time
Here at Linfox we believe together, anything is possible. Use sophisticated technology to deliver everyday essentials and natural resources for Australia’s biggest companies. Work with major customers in retail, healthcare, government and defence. Shape the future of logistics with industry leading innovations in safety, sustainability and efficiency. Create a career to be proud of. Expect all this and more when you join Linfox.
What does the job look like?

The Consumer and Healthcare Group Business Unit are currently seeking a passionate Commercial Analyst to be based at our Essendon Fields Head Office in Victoria. This is an exciting opportunity for a motivated and proactive analyst with strong operational experience.

You will be overseeing the commercial and financial aspects, in addition to actively supporting the growth and development of this contract. You will be responsible for providing in-depth reporting and ongoing business analysis to assist the operations for this key contract. You will strive to improve the efficiency and competitiveness of the operations to ensure optimal performance. Key areas:

Provision of timely and accurate information for the weekly generation of financial reporting and billing of customers
Support business objectives by analysing site information and management requirements
Proactively collaborating with the operational team to streamline current process and /or data management
Managing and improving analytical and financial modelling tools and systems
Coordination of weekly, monthly, quarterly reviews with the customer

Are you the one?

This is an outstanding opportunity for a passionate, hands on individual to help deliver best practice outcomes. You can demonstrate:

High attention to detail with a systematic and organised approach to work
Previous experience in commercial and financial functions within the transport and logistics industry will be highly regarded
Bachelor’s degree in Accounting/Finance/Business/Supply Chain will be highly regarded
Well-rounded analytical skills and commercial judgement
Strong communication skills and ability to develop internal and external relationships
Intermediate to advanced skills in MS-Excel is essential and CPA or CA qualification will be highly regarded

Sound like you? Please click the apply button to submit your application and resume.

We kindly request no unsolicited resumes or approaches from Recruitment Agencies. Linfox is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Further information

You will be required to meet Linfox's employment criteria which will include but not be limited to a criminal history check and full medical with a drug and alcohol test."]

title: ['Strategy Analyst']
description:
["Energy Safe Victoria (ESV) is Victoria's safety regulator responsible for electricity, gas and pipeline safety. Our role is to ensure that Victorian gas and electricity industries are safe and meet community expectations. We are also responsible for licensing and registering electricians, and educating the community about energy safety. Our people come from a wide range of professions with diverse skills and experience driving the success of ESV.
About the opportunity
We have an exciting 6 month fixed-term opportunity reporting to the Head of Risk and Strategy, as the Strategy Analyst you will be responsible for reviewing, supporting and managing major project deliverables.This includes establishing a formal strategic planning process, including alignment with the Commission operating rhythm.


Assist the Head of Risk and Strategy to manage the annual strategy lifecycle to produce strategy drafts and ESV's annual Corporate Plan.
Assess strategy inputs and data analytical outputs to support the development of strategic options.
Facilitate, document, and coordinate workshops and processes with various key stakeholders to identify strategy inputs and positions.
Assist the Head of Risk and Strategy to design and establish a revised enterprise risk management approach.
Identify, analyse and maintain ESV's understanding of strategic risks.
Design and document elements of ESV's strategy lifecycle.

To be successful, you'll have:

Tertiary qualifications relevant to organisational strategy development.
Demonstrable experience working within organisational strategy lifecycle and processes.
Stakeholder engagement and coordination competencies.
Highly developed interpersonal and communication skills (written and verbal).
Ability to define strategic problems and identify solution options.
Strong project management skillsets to scope, design and deliver business requirements.
Highly developed organisational and coordination skills with attention to detail.

Why join us?
At Energy Safe Victoria we offer roles that enable our people to feel valued by making a meaningful contribution to the Victorian community. We pride ourselves on our collaborative and supportive culture, and support the skills and career development of our people through regular leaning, development and growth opportunities.
How to apply
Please refer to the available position description to assess your suitability and submit your current resume and cover letter via the Apply button. ESV will conduct relevant and required checks about applicants and the information provided with an application. Such checks will include but are not limited to:


ESV contacting current and previous employer(s) to substantiate employment history, past conduct and performance is required.
A satisfactory National Police Check will be required (for all non-ESV employees).

Please note that the location for this opportunity may temporarily be working from home due to the current requirements for all Victorians to practice social distancing amid the pandemic."]

title: ['Pricing Analyst']
description:
['Why choose us?
Icon Group is Australia’s largest dedicated cancer care provider with a growing reach into New Zealand and Asia. With over 2,500 employees company-wide, the Group’s cancer services include over 30 cancer centres, 3 large chemotherapy compounding facilities and over 50 pharmacies across Australia. Icon is dedicated to providing exceptional cancer care to communities across Australia.

We are truly dedicated to providing genuine patient-centred care and what unites us is the community we have built. Icon’s future success depends on the quality and commitment of our team, so we are devoted to empowering our people to thrive in their career through personal and professional growth and development.

Benefits:
Rewards and recognition program
Paid parental leave
Professional development program

About the Role:
Newly created permanent full-time position working 38 hrs per week. Join our dynamic team and be based at head office in Mt Waverly.

Reporting to the commercial operations manager, you will support finance, pharmacy and procurement to identify, assess and recommend changes to pricing strategy, gross margin management and improvements to current practices. You will also prepare new pricing models to support procurement, pharmacy and compounding and the broader business.

Key Responsibilities:
Supplier price monitoring and contact price adherence
Monitor and report gross margin
Create reports to provide analysis of varying pricing approaches
Management of product pricing strategies across B2B and B2C channels
Determine root cause of variances in gross margin
Design and validate new scheduled reports to support all aspects of pricing management
Develop accurate reporting of current and future margins based on changes to product mix at a site and macro level
Stock take verification and reporting
Provide end of month reports to finance and operational teams including commentary regarding monthly results, movements, and abnormal events
Support finance and operational teams by providing investigative support regarding inventory transactions and margins

About you:
Strong understanding of Pharmaceutical Benefits Scheme
Ability to work independently and build strong working relationships with key stakeholders
Strong commercial and business acumen
Ability to think laterally about complex concepts and business problems in order to convert into something measurable/calculable
Exceptional communication skills including strong business case writing
Experience with Microsoft AX Enterprise System

How to apply?

Please click ‘apply now’ and attach your resume and cover letter to your application.']

title: ['Data Analyst']
description:
["About us:
We’re known for being the country’s most popular rewards program, making the everyday worth more for millions of Aussies. But 26 years of success and growth doesn’t happen by keeping up the status quo.
All the things that make working at Flybuys different as usual – these aren't just values we talk about. They’re built into everything we do, every day.
Be part of a company that's always questioned the norm. A business that's well-established, but still expanding. With one eye on the horizon.
And together we can make every day different as usual.
Your Team:
We've already built a pretty amazing team, but we're not looking for more of the same. Our day-to-day is made stronger when we surround ourselves with people who are different, like you.
We work really hard to build teams that support each other. It’s the kind of environment you’ll miss while you’re on holidays.
Your Role:
There is no typical working week at Flybuys. But here are some of the things you might be working on, day-to-day;
Work with Analytics and Commercial teams to articulate the customer opportunity, commercial benefit, analytical findings.
Respond to requests from partners and Commercial team in a timely fashion, providing accurate, QC'd analysis and findings.
Have input on workload prioritisation, with informed view of relative value of each analytics request.
Showcase, benchmark and quantify the value and outcomes of analytics based decision making.
Translate complex mathematical techniques into consumable and commercial concepts, with a focus on promoting the value of the flybuys program.
Participate in planning with key customers to create a joined up vision and deliverables.
Source, develop and apply new and existing analytical methods and techniques.
Use of a variety of sources to keep abreast of industry practices.
Ensure key stakeholders are updated, ensuring the commercial impact has been explored / communicate.
Your Experience:
Tertiary Qualified in Business, Mathematics or Science discipline.
Analytics professional with a proven track record, (minimum 3 years working experience)
Experience in Campaign, Digital and Reporting analytics - from planning to post campaign analysis.
Great influencing and storytelling skills and the ability to navigate internal and external organisations to build and leverage relationships.
Experience in clearly articulating commercial benefits of analytics.
Naturally collaborative with a strong emphasis on building and leveraging relationships both internally and externally.
Experience of large, complex data sets.
Naturally curious, able to positively challenge existing practices.
Experience of analytical tools – data extraction, data exploration and analysis, data visualisation.
Experience of working within large, complex, cross functional projects .
Technical skills including Oracle SQL, R, BI experience (e.g.Tableau, MicroStrategy)
Experience with Snowflake would be advantageous.
We value ways of working that work for everyone, and use our different strengths to make us stronger.
We work hard to make sure everyone’s voice is heard and respected equally, regardless of identity, background, position, ability or lifestyle.
So whether you’re an earlybird list maker, a night owl coder, a brainstorm chaser or a PowerPoint proof-reader, we want you to Be You, With Us."]

title: ['Performance Reporting Analyst / BI Analyst']
description:
['There’s never been a better time to be at AGL
At AGL, we believe progress is powered by our people.
If you’re set on making real change for tomorrow, we have the scale, resources and ambition to get it started today.
Now’s an extraordinary time to work with us. We’re taking the lead on renewables and expanding our products to make them more sustainable, affordable and useful for all Australians.
That’s what we call progress. To achieve it, we’re bringing together people with unique stories, perspectives, backgrounds and talent – and we need yours too!
About the Role
Drive automation of reporting and utilisation of data visualisation tools
Advanced user: Power BI, Excel & PowerPoint
Permanent opportunity based in Melbourne or Sydney
The Enterprise Services Reporting, Data & Analytics team provides reporting and insights to support a broad range of stakeholders across Enterprise Services and AGL. There are three focus areas to the team:
Master data - Are custodians of vendor and material master data creation and maintenance
Performance reporting - Provide a centre-led service to the broader Enterprise Services team and business through the development of key performance metrics, reporting solutions and facilitation of high-quality reporting on activities
Third party commercial insights - Provide analytical and decision support to Enterprise Services and the business on third party commercial issues affecting the business. These include strategic initiatives, projects and identification of value opportunities
The Performance Reporting Analyst is principally responsible for the following:
Performing analysis of AGL’s Enterprise Services’ teams and providing meaningful insights into performance metrics and KPIs, contributing to the achievement of Enterprise Services goals
Automate reporting to enable accessibility, timely and accurate insights to drive decision making
What you’ll be doing:
Developing and maintaining reports utilising data visualisation tools (Power BI)
Promoting self-service functionality and providing feedback to enhancement of SAP tools
Assisting in the preparation of the monthly Enterprise Services reports & monthly variance analysis on performance metrics including savings targets, compliance, Accounts Payable and Purchasing metrics, work on a range of ad hoc reporting and initiatives as required
Ensuring governance is achieved by reporting and monitoring adherence to Enterprise Services policies and standards
Coordinating and consolidating PT3 benefits reporting & social license reporting
Ownership of tools, dashboards and techniques to improve performance management and spend visibility
Business partnering with key stakeholders and teams across the Procure-to-Pay value chain and Enterprise Services to build out meaningful insights based on metrics reported
Training staff on dashboards and reporting tools
Assisting Manager Reporting, Data & Analytics as required
About You
What you’ll bring to the table:
Demonstrated previous experience in a similar Performance Analyst / BI Analyst role in a complex corporate environment, synthesising and presenting insights to stakeholders
Experience working/reporting in a shared service, procure-to-pay environment preferred
Advanced Power BI, Excel & PowerPoint skills essential, with previous exposure to SAP S4
Excellent written and verbal communication skills and strong business acumen
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with proven ability to interact with and maintain effective relationships across diverse stakeholder groups
Demonstrated problem solving skills with strong attention to detail
We’d love to see your application, submitted by this date: 6th December 2020.
Reach out to Greg Higginbotham, Recruitment Partner if you have any questions via: ghigginbotham @agl.com.au .
At AGL all employees are encouraged to be themselves and to bring their whole selves to work every day. We encourage applications from Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander people, people living with disability, culturally and linguistically diverse people and people of the LGBTQ+ community, including transgender, gender diverse, and intersex people. AGL has a commitment to maintain a diverse workforce, so welcomes the opportunity for applicants to share their lived experiences but recognises that some applicants may not wish to disclose, so that option is supported.
Please note - unsolicited resumes from agencies will not be accepted by AGL.
Job Family Group:
Finance and Accounting']

title: ['Rating Analyst/ Research Assistant']
description:
['The Role: Research Assistant/Rating Analyst
The Location: Melbourne, Australia
The Role: You will be a critical member in the credit ratings team for the Infrastructure and Utilities Practice. You are responsible for supporting senior analysts in the Pacific (Australia and New Zealand) team in analyzing individual company’s financial performance, competitive industry placement and quality of management for analytical purposes. This analysis also includes sectors and market trends and comparisons to peers in Asia Pacific and globally. You will also be responsible for the development of spreadsheet statistics and databases and will be actively involved supporting senior analysts in the development of rating committee presentations, portfolio reviews and thought leadership aimed at investors and other financial market participants.
The Team / The Business: The Practice was established by S&P Global Ratings to expand our ratings franchise in an area of strong global growth and to leverage our significant infrastructure expertise across the full range of infrastructure asset classes. Globally, Practice team members reside in 24 locations and work on a diverse range of transactions applying different ratings criteria, predominantly corporate and project finance. We also work on transactions in partnership with other practices on a regular basis. Effective teamwork, strong written and verbal communication skills and a thoughtful approach to problem solving are highly valued.
Your skills: Bachelor degree is required. Rating Analysts will have in-depth knowledge of market updates in the financial and corporate industry. You have strong analytical and research skills. Candidates with less experience may be considered as a Research Assistant.
Responsibilities:
Collects economic and financial information specific to a relevant markets or organizations, conducts market sector or statistical analysis and interprets key market data elements into useful business information
Leverages broad scope of knowledge when performing analysis on data sets
Focuses on theory and concepts, applying quantitative or analytical skills to complete projects/studies/tasks
Conducts research including identifying data, data inputs, and statistical analysis of results and creates and maintains data and analysis reports
Works closely with senior analysts to ensure most recent information is updated in the financial model
Support senior analysts to prepares presentations and participate in meetings with clients
Requirements:
Bachelor degree in business, finance, accounting or related subjects
Pursuing CPA or CFA designation will be ideal
1 – 3 years of research or analytical experience with other financial institutions
Strong PowerPoint, Excel and analytical skills to collate and analyze a wide range of information
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Good organization skills and very high attention to details
Good time management and prioritization; managing priorities while maintaining high standards and strong ability to work as part of team
About S&P Global Ratings
S&P Global Ratings is the world’s leading provider of independent credit ratings. Our ratings are essential to driving growth, providing transparency and helping educate market participants so they can make decisions with confidence. We have more than 1 million credit ratings outstanding on government, corporate, financial sector and structured finance entities and securities. We offer an independent view of the market built on a unique combination of broad perspective and local insight. We provide our opinions and research about relative credit risk; market participants gain independent information to help support the growth of transparent, liquid debt markets worldwide.
S&P Global Ratings is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies and governments to make decisions with confidence. For more information, visit www.spglobal.com/ratings
S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer committed to making all employment decisions without regard to race/ethnicity, gender, pregnancy, gender identity or expression, color, creed, religion, national origin, age, disability, marital status (including domestic partnerships and civil unions), sexual orientation, military veteran status, unemployment status, or other legally protected categories, subject to applicable law.']

title: ['Application Support Analyst']
description:
["
MRI Software support experience essential
Melbourne CBD location
Fantastic opportunity to build your career with a respected global organisation

About us:
At Knight Frank Australia we achieve exceptional results for our clients through a combination of expertise, innovation, and a personalised approach. Our culture of high performance and genuine warmth allows us to strike the right balance - and that makes all the difference. As a member of a global network, we are a 700-strong national team who apply local, national, global insights effectively for our clients. We celebrate the individuality of our people, and we collaborate effectively to deliver the best solutions.

The role:
The primary focus of this role is the daily maintenance/monitoring and rectification of data issues in the MRI (https://www.mrisoftware.com/au/) and VISION Databases. Providing application support for property management systems and users.
The role also has a significant focus on accounting practices, T-SQL querying and analysis. Other responsibilities include troubleshooting and development of T-SQL stored procedures, producing technical documentation, change management and project work, as required.

Key tasks:

Prompt logging, analysis and resolution of 1st level service desk support cases.
Providing outstanding customer service to internal and external clients
Resolution of known application data issues
Analysis of financial reports to reconcile variances identified by the business
Analysis and development of T-SQL stored procedures
Pro-active identification and resolution of potential support issues.
Assessment of application versions (MRI), and mapping features between internal applications

Who we are looking for?


Min. 2 year's demonstrable experience supporting and maintaining enterprise database systems (in particular, MRI Software)
Tertiary qualification in computer science/information technology, or currently undertaking studies
Intermediate T-SQL ability and SQL Database experience
Microsoft .Net Experience
Knowledge of accounting practices
Excellent verbal & written communication skills
Proven ability to work independently and as part of a team
Proven ability to take initiative, identify issues and deliver timely solutions
Strong customer service with a collaborative focus and approach

What's in it for you?


Knight Frank Australia will be your platform to rise and do your best work - we are a diverse collection of experts, problem solvers, innovators and high performers. We believe we are at our best when we work together.
Competitive remuneration package
Flexible working opportunities, purchase leave, volunteering leave and paid parental leave
Opportunity to develop your skillset through digital learning over 300 courses, mentoring program, on-the-job learning

Applicants with Australian working rights need only apply.
No Agencies please."]

title: ['Analyst, Tech Service Support']
description:
["Work type: Permanent Full time
Location: Aust - VIC Metro

Outstanding opportunity to build and progress your career
Committed to working flexibly
Join a team that’s invested in you

A career that gives you more
Your career at NAB is about more than money, it's about serving our customers well and helping our communities prosper. We currently have an opportunity for an Analyst, Tech Service Support.

As we continue to work with new technology and expand our digital capabilities, we’re making everyday tasks simpler and quicker for our customers – leaving them more time for more important things. If you’re passionate about being part of an exciting operational team, you’re exactly the sort of person we’re looking for.

This role will take accountability for providing end-user support for the end-user computing services along with access management and field support when required. NAB provide onsite user support services and some field work may be required.

Key responsibilities:

Initial entry point for IMAC ((Installs, Moves, Adds, Changes) requests that require triage or client contact
End to End ownership of all request or incidents managed by IMAC & Incident & access management team
Responsible for meeting agreed KPI or SLA’s for requests assigned to achieve team targets.
Escalation of request or incident tickets to relevant support teams to ensure KPI or SLAs met
Provisioning of Standard / Non-standard and privileged accounts
Providing technical support of all facets of the Desktop environment, including Printer support
Implement and manage upgrades in SCCM
Use your Active Directory experience for support and implementation
Strong awareness and understanding of hardware, networks, software technologies and applications
knowledge in software distribution and patch management is desirable

What you will bring

While knowing the ins and outs of the latest technology is key, we’re also looking for someone with proven experience in Microsoft EUC based Workplace Technology and delivery. You will also have a strong background in the practical use, support and deployment of large-scale EUC environments and experience with Active Directory, UNIX/Linux account provisioning.

Working in a challenging, fast-paced environment, you’ll need drive, resilience and versatility. You’ll also be working with people from around the business, including key stakeholders, so a respectful attitude and the ability to build good relationships is vital.

You will be ambitious for growth; always curious and learning from colleagues. You will speak honestly, always valuing the time and opinion of others. You will own your work, doing what’s right, even when it’s hard.

By joining NAB, you are committing to putting our customers’ needs first every time. You will be ambitious for growth; always curious and learning from colleagues. You will speak honestly, always valuing the time and opinion of others. You will own your work, doing what’s right, even when it’s hard.

NAB, invested in you
We are committed to gender equality and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and have a diverse and inclusive workforce. We have committed $70bn in financing to help address climate change and provide 2 days of paid leave each year through our employee volunteering program to support community organisations.

We support our colleagues to be their best by offering a wide range of educational, financial, lifestyle, health & wellbeing benefits. For more information please visit here.

Join NAB

If you think this role is the right fit for you, we invite you to apply. Let’s explore who you are and what drives you. We’d love to share our vision for the future of banking.

To be eligible to apply, you must have Australian or New Zealand citizenship or permanent residency status. Please note candidate screening and interviews may be conducted prior to the closing date of the job advert.
Please note unsolicited CVs from agencies will not be accepted"]

title: ['Business Analyst']
description:
['The speed of change is throwing traditional business methods into question and disrupting the relevance of entire industries. Capgemini, a global leader in consulting, digital transformation, technology and engineering services, is at the forefront of innovation and well placed to address opportunities for our clients in the evolving world of cloud, digital and platforms. Building on its strong 50-year heritage and deep industry-specific expertise, Capgemini enables organisations to realise their business ambitions through an array of services from strategy to operations. Capgemini is driven by the conviction that the business value of technology comes from and through people. Today, it is a multicultural company with over 270,000 team members in almost 50 countries. With Altran, the Group reported 2019 combined revenues of EUR 17 billion. Learn more about us at www.capgemini.com.

Let's talk about the team:
At Capgemini we are proud of our diverse team of professionals providing the right expertise to our clients in all aspects of the projects we deliver. We work with an impressive range of clients globally to assist them in delivering their business outcomes with an emphasis on innovation and progressive technology.

Let's talk about the role and responsibilities:

Conducting a detailed business analysis, outlining problems, opportunities and solutions for a business.
Understanding the life cycle of various processes within business and support teams and performing an impact analysis on various systems, data and processes involved.
Modelling business processes and identifying opportunities for process improvements.
Creating process documents for newly implemented process and conducting a training session for operational users.
Running the support data processes for Support teams and identifying opportunities for process improvements.
Managing and maintaining reporting dashboards for various business processes, presenting the dashboards to key stakeholders.
Supporting business transition and helping to establish change.
Support business team's data requirements in their business initiatives.
Understanding end-to-end processes, while performing specific support tasks.

Let's talk about your qualifications and experience:

5+ years experience in the Banking & Finance industry and/or compliance projects
Experience across enterprise delivery, release process, risk engagement, change management etc
Experience with the Atlassian suite (Jira + Confluence)
Business process and work instructions documentation experience
Effective Stakeholder Management, Critical Thinking, Problem Solving, Decision Making, Documentation & Writing Skills, Confident Presenter
Experience writing user stories, defining acceptance criteria and working closely with engineers and testers to ensure a quality outcome

Let's talk about what's in it for you!
Passionate people are Capgemini's Ace of Spades - join us to discover a career that will challenge, support and inspire you. Working at Capgemini you'll find the rewards are more than just financial. You will work alongside some very smart and inspiring people on exciting projects and you will also enjoy incredible benefits. We offer flexible work practices and 40 hours of self-development every year with a huge selection of learning opportunities to choose from.
As "Architects of Positive Futures", Capgemini actively supports the community in 3 ways:
Diversity and Inclusion - we believe diversity of thought fuels excellence and innovation, which is why we positively encourage applications from suitably qualified candidates regardless of their gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, religion, ability, intersex status or age. To support our commitment to diversity and inclusion, we celebrate special events and days of significance that are important to our employees such as Diwali, Bastille Day, Pride, IDAHOBIT, IWD and International day of people with Disabilities. Our Employee Resource Groups Women@Capgemini and OutFront support the grassroots passion of employees to drive our diversity agenda and effect change.
Digital inclusion - at Capgemini we are using our skills to drive social impact initiatives focusing on helping society address the impact of the digital and automation revolution. We also provide employees with opportunities to give back to the community through charity projects and volunteer days.
Environmental Sustainability - Capgemini joined the CDP's (Carbon Disclosure Project) prestigious "A list" for its commitment to the Net-Zero economy. We are focusing on helping our clients transform towards more sustainable business models and committing to reduce our own carbon emissions (GHG) by 20% per employee by 2020.
Recognised by Ethisphere as one of the World's Most Ethical Companies for the last 8 years in a row, ethics and values are at the heart of Capgemini's corporate culture and business. Embedded in our DNA, our seven values - Honesty, Boldness, Trust, Team Spirit, Freedom, Fun and Modesty - have remained the same since company inception in 1967. To see how we bring these values to life, click here to listen to some of our employee's stories.
Come join us, bring your whole self to work, create new possibilities for you, your customers and your community and help us to be Architects of Positive Futures.

Please note unsolicited resumes from employment agencies or other third parties will not be considered.
#LI-SR1']

title: ['Integrated Business Planning (IBP) Analyst']
description:
['Become a Part of the NIKE, Inc. Team
NIKE, Inc. does more than outfit the world’s best athletes. It is a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders and visionaries. At NIKE, Inc. it’s about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game.
Every successful team At NIKE, Inc. Inc. needs a brilliant game plan. Strategic Planning teams keep the company moving in the right direction by leading the strategic business planning process and spearheading transformational projects across Nike businesses and geographies. Embedded in teams across the company, strategy professionals explore complex business issues; conduct consumer, competitive and market analyses; create financial models and develop action plans. The Strategic Planning teams help write the future of sport by charting Nike’s path forward.
We are currently recruiting for the position of Integrated Business Planning (IBP) Analyst; this is a permanent position reporting into the Pacific IBP Manager.

WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR?
As Integrated Business Planning Analyst, you will become a part of an extensive cross-functional team driving overall financial, operational and marketplace performance for the Territory. You will support the Territory IBP offense that facilitates the IBP process by gathering information from a wide range of sources, analyzing and preparing stories relative to the operating plan and business monitoring. You will drive timely decisions and actions around risk & opportunities. Your cross functional partnerships will include but are not limited to teams from Demand & Supply Management, Integrated Marketplace, Finance, Nike Direct, Operations and Geo IBP.


WHAT WILL YOU WORK ON?
Integrated Business Planning strategy execution including but not limited to;

IBP CONSENSUS PLAN SUPPORT

Maintain a 6 season rolling integrated Consensus Plan forecast for PacificSupport execution of Monthly Consensus Operating Plan in accordance with the Integrated Business Planning Process (IBP Process) inclusive of Territory and Geo reporting by partnering with cross functional teams to ensure objectives, deliverables and outcomes are aligned and achievedOwnership of the forecast tool (Anaplan) and outputs. Partnership with APLA for successful tool enhancements and leverage the tool to facilitate robust discussions.
IBP ECOSYSTEM

Ensure a planning environment operates effectively to support sustainable, profitable growthFocus on feedback loops and integration of key assumptions throughout various cross functional forecast gatesElevate and track risks and opportunities through IBP Ecosystem.
BUSINESS MONITORING PROCESS SUPPORT

Schedule meetings and provide support for both local and Geo Executive/ Management IBP meetings through preparing agenda and deliverablesOwn cancels process, including reporting and alignment with Marketplace Financial Planning Managers on a monthly cadence. Align with APLA IP on long range cancel forecastsCollection of data and insights from cross functional managers for executed meetings and communication with related teams to ensure functional representationSupport IBP Manager on ad hoc analysis including cross functional scenario planning with focus on risks, opportunities and mitigation plansPositively contribute to achievement of agreed Pacific Big 5 KPI’sPromote excess inventory conversations and impacts to delivering the plan
WHAT YOU BRING TO NIKE

Bachelor degree in Business, Operations, Supply Chain, Finance or a related fieldAt least 2 years’ experience in relevant business environment, preferably a large organisationUnderstanding of broad operational, financial and marketplace conceptsBusiness analysis and quantitative skills to approach scenarios methodically with fact based insightsExcellent communication skills (written, verbal and presentations) influencing and collaborationAbility to foster strong relationships with Nike partners across functions both in Pacific and APLAProficient in MS Office (Excel, PowerPoint) with Tableau/Cognos experience favourable.
APPLICATION DEADLINE IS MONDAY 30th of NOVEMBER
NIKE, Inc. is a growth company that looks for team members to grow with it. Nike offers a generous total rewards package, casual work environment, a diverse and inclusive culture, and an electric atmosphere for professional development. No matter the location, or the role, every Nike employee shares one galvanizing mission: To bring inspiration and innovation to every athlete* in the world.
NIKE, Inc. is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability.']

title: ['Replenishment Analyst']
description:
["Job no: 935184
Work type: Permanent / Full time
Location: Support Office - Docklands

Work is a whole lot better when you love what you do, we know that. That’s why we make sure that the loves and interests of our people match their responsibilities. We take what they love, and we let them live it.
So, do you want to be part of a team who loves coming to work each day? A team that makes Myer a great place to shop, and an even greater place to work?

As a Replenishment Analyst for Entertainment, you will play a pivotal role in delivering the end-to-end management of merchandise replenishment and strategic product planning. A part of the Merchandise team, you will have the exciting opportunity to collaborate with the wider team and key stakeholders, ensuring customer demand has been met, both in-store and online.

Opportunity to be a part of and execute special projects
Make an impact within a dynamic and collaborative team
Ongoing training and development for your progression

About The Role:

Management of supplier purchase orders from tracking, follow up and communication
Ensuring the accuracy of system generated orders and driving best practice
Monitor and track product performance, providing your specialist advice to the business for post-season reviews
Directly liaising with suppliers, stores and key stakeholders to effectively execute seamless replenishment processes
Managing the setting of replenishment parameters, delivering efficiency when replenishing merchandise through the supply chain
Strategic thinking and forecasting, providing appropriate product planning support and utilisation for the merchandise team
Adhering to the critical timelines of the demand planning and replenishment critical path

About You:

Previous experience in stock management or replenishment (retail preferred)
Intermediate computer technology and systems skills, particularly Microsoft Excel
A strategic thinker with the ability to forecast, as well as obtaining a strong financial, analytical and business acumen
A confident professional with the ability to influence a team, leaders and key stakeholders
Able to positively contribute to a dynamic team, being a flexible and adaptable team player
Strong time management skills with the ability to effectively prioritize and drive efficiency
Bachelors degree or qualifications in Business Analytics, Commerce, Logistics/Supply Chain, Finance or Merchandise (advantageous but not essential)

The Benefits:

Generous team member discounts on all Myer products
The experience to work alongside industry pioneers
Ongoing training and development for your career progression
The opportunity to be a part of and contribute to the Myer growth strategy

If you are ready to make your mark within Australia's Largest Department store, don't miss this opportunity.

APPLY NOW!

Aust. Working Rights: To be eligible to apply for this job, you must have Australian working rights. For further information contact the Australian Department of Immigration.

Equal Opp. Employer: We pride ourselves on the diversity of the people who work at Myer, representing the community in which we serve.

Agency note: Myer Pty Ltd does not accept unsolicited resumes/candidate profiles from external agencies or suppliers via any method. Any candidates submitted in an unsolicited manner, will be considered a direct candidate application to Myer and no fee will be payable.
Applications close: 27 Nov 2020 AUS Eastern Daylight Time"]

title: ['Systems Analyst']
description:
['Line of Service
Assurance
Industry/Sector
Not Applicable
Specialism
Assurance
Management Level
Associate
Job Description & Summary
With PwC, you’ll ignite a meaningful career while being supported by a flexible working culture, innovative learning and development opportunities and progressive policies and benefits, such as 18 weeks paid parental leave for mums, dads and foster carers (no minimum service!)
What will you create?
You’ll help Australian businesses, not-for-profits and governments create value and improve the way they work. From digitising healthcare, to creating smarter cities and igniting our start-up industry, together we build trust in society and solve important problems.
Trust and Risk bring this to life by helping clients to protect and strengthen every aspect of their business; from people to performance, systems to strategy and business plans to business resilience.
As an Systems Analyst our Technology Risk team your impact will be seen by:
Being responsible for anticipating and identifying risks and raise issues with line management to support our commitment to risk and quality.
Preparing and reviewing of financial statements
Analysing and documenting of internal controls and control Environments
Knowing all aspects of audit and statutory reporting
About you
You have a background in a technology controls environment and are skilled in IT general control (ITGC) reviews, automated controls, system-generated reports, internal audits and service organisation controls reports. You hold an understanding of the complexity around technology issues and how to solve them from strategy to execution.
Passionate about being at the forefront of change, you’re ready to help our Risk Assurance practice transform how risk is perceived and capitalised on.
You’re collaborative and enjoy working in an innovative environment. You’re a problem solver by nature and want to join a firm that values the kind of people who reimagine the possible for their clients and stakeholders. Most importantly, you act with integrity and show care for the people you work with.
Life at PwC
Our culture and benefits are something we’re proud of, and also the reason we’ve been named LinkedIn’s #1 Australian workplace. With PwC, you’ll belong to an inclusive community where differences are both embraced and the underlying driver in everything we create together.
We empower you with the technology, coaching, flexibility and trust needed to make a meaningful difference, while supporting you in bringing your whole self to work each day. We’re committed to building and maintaining a diverse workforce because we know it’s only by working together that we can realise the potential of our people, clients and society around us.
We’re living this commitment through initiatives including our Reconciliation Action Plan to increase Indigenous employment and employee-led diversity networks promoting cultural, disability, LGBTI and gender equality. At our core we’re a people business, which means you’ll be supported not just in your professional development but your personal growth as well.
Wiona Court is the Recruitment Manager for the role. As the team experience high volumes of applications, we appreciate your patience to allow for a timely and fair process for all.
We welcome the opportunity to speak to candidates about our value proposition and recognition and reward approach. The minimum full time salary for this role is $68,000 including 9.5% Superannuation, however will be determined based on the skills and experience that the candidate brings. #LI-PWCLMT
