In depth knowledge of Sonata registry system
Excellent analytical skills
Strong organisation and planning skills
Ability to work independently
Excellent knowledge of superannuation legislation and insurance within superannuation
Good communication skills
Strong coaching skills
About us:
Mercer builds brighter futures by redefining the world of work, reshaping retirement and investment outcomes, and unlocking real health and well-being. Mercer’s more than 25,000 employees are based in 44 countries and the firm operates in over 130 countries. Mercer is a business of Marsh & McLennan (NYSE: MMC), the world’s leading professional services firm in the areas of risk, strategy and people, with 75,000 colleagues and annualized revenue approaching $17 billion. Through its market-leading businesses including Marsh, Guy Carpenter and Oliver Wyman, Marsh & McLennan helps clients navigate an increasingly dynamic and complex environment. For more information, visit www.mercer.com. Follow Mercer on Twitter @Mercer.
Mercer is an equal opportunity employer committed to embracing a diverse, inclusive and flexible work environment. We aim to attract and retain the best people regardless of their sex (including intersex), marital/parental status, ethnic origin, nationality, age, background, disability, sexual orientation and gender identity.
Please apply using the link below, applications will only be considered from candidates who have the appropriate approval to work in Australia. Successful applicants will be required to complete a Criminal & Bankruptcy check prior to commencement of employment.']

title: ['Analyst - Deloitte Managed Solutions']
description:
['Date: 10-Nov-2020

Location:
Melbourne, VIC, AU Sydney, NSW, AU Brisbane, QLD, AU

Department:Description:
Analyst

Multiple opportunities in our Managed Solutions team
Hybrid working environment across multiple locations.
Deloitte Flex - We recognise the importance of balance and embrace agility

What will your typical day look like?

Join our Deloitte Managed Solutions (DMS) team as we support our clients in responding to their most important and complex business needs, operating bespoke delivery programs with quality, speed and efficiency across a wide range of industries and sectors. No two days are the same but typical daily activities could include:

Provide operational support to business proposals and engagement activity across our existing or new clients in response to important and complex client issues.
Help lead the execution of our programs through structured problem solving, effective time management and providing our teams with the support and guidance needed to deliver high quality outcomes efficiently and effectively.
Providing project and client operational reporting, such as performance and status/forecast reporting.
Working in a fast-paced, target-driven environments, whilst maintaining composure in dealing with complex and challenging operational issues.
Support resourcing and operational requirements to scale-up our large-scale programs.
Thrive in a multi-disciplinary team environment and adopt different working styles to meet different approaches in our work
Involvement in the preparation of operational financial management tools and budgets.
Build authentic and trusted relationships with our teams and the broader Deloitte firm.

About the team

The financial services industry and other industries and sectors are facing significant headwinds responding to misconduct which has resulted in a loss of customer trust and reputational damage. Organisations have responded by setting up large scale remediation programs and at Deloitte, through our DMS practice, we support our clients in re-building trust and delivering confidence on issues that matter most.

Our vision is to assist our clients with important and complex issues and challenges: typically, in delivering large scale complex and bespoke delivery programs, often in short timescales, bringing our expertise and excellence in execution to help our clients respond to their issues, with quality, speed and efficiency.

Enough about us, let’s talk about you. You are someone with:
1 - 2 years financial services industry experience across any of the following: Retail Banking/Wholesale/Investments/Banking/ Insurance/Super/lending/credit or Public sector experience
A proven track record delivering or being involved in large-scale operational projects, investigations or remedial reviews;
Strong technical skills relating to process mapping, Excel, Visio and other operational I.T. skills
Effective communication and interpersonal skills
Enthusiasm and a passion to succeed
Experience of change management in terms of an operational context and an ability to work easily in a transitional period

Why Deloitte?

At Deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. We value difference and embrace people with diverse backgrounds and thinking styles. Knowing that people work best in different ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated.']

title: ['Pricing Analyst']
description:
['Why choose us?
Icon Group is Australia’s largest dedicated cancer care provider with a growing reach into New Zealand and Asia. With over 2,500 employees company-wide, the Group’s cancer services include over 30 cancer centres, 3 large chemotherapy compounding facilities and over 50 pharmacies across Australia. Icon is dedicated to providing exceptional cancer care to communities across Australia.

We are truly dedicated to providing genuine patient-centred care and what unites us is the community we have built. Icon’s future success depends on the quality and commitment of our team, so we are devoted to empowering our people to thrive in their career through personal and professional growth and development.

Benefits:
Rewards and recognition program
Paid parental leave
Professional development program

About the Role:
Newly created permanent full-time position working 38 hrs per week. Join our dynamic team and be based at head office in Mt Waverly.

Reporting to the commercial operations manager, you will support finance, pharmacy and procurement to identify, assess and recommend changes to pricing strategy, gross margin management and improvements to current practices. You will also prepare new pricing models to support procurement, pharmacy and compounding and the broader business.

Key Responsibilities:
Supplier price monitoring and contact price adherence
Monitor and report gross margin
Create reports to provide analysis of varying pricing approaches
Management of product pricing strategies across B2B and B2C channels
Determine root cause of variances in gross margin
Design and validate new scheduled reports to support all aspects of pricing management
Develop accurate reporting of current and future margins based on changes to product mix at a site and macro level
Stock take verification and reporting
Provide end of month reports to finance and operational teams including commentary regarding monthly results, movements, and abnormal events
Support finance and operational teams by providing investigative support regarding inventory transactions and margins

About you:
Strong understanding of Pharmaceutical Benefits Scheme
Ability to work independently and build strong working relationships with key stakeholders
Strong commercial and business acumen
Ability to think laterally about complex concepts and business problems in order to convert into something measurable/calculable
Exceptional communication skills including strong business case writing
Experience with Microsoft AX Enterprise System

How to apply?

Please click ‘apply now’ and attach your resume and cover letter to your application.']

title: ['Cyber Risk Analyst']
description:
["About Us

The Endeavour Group ambition is bold, we want to be the world's best drinks retailer. We know that expectations of retail have never been higher so our transactions must be instant, and our services must be intuitive and personal. We are embarking on our next generation of growth, and we want you to be an influential part of it.

Our family of leading brands is well respected and highly visible throughout Australia, New Zealand and the world; from Dan Murphy’s, our market leading destination drinks merchant, to our local convenience offering at BWS, and our Cellarmaster wines and Langtons businesses with each of them commanding a leadership position in their respective category.

About the Role:

Our Cyber Risk Analyst will identify, triage and manage cybersecurity risk within the Endeavour group and its banners. An Internally Facing role with a strong need to manage relationships with stakeholders to ensure the optimal management of cybersecurity-related risk for 80% of the role.The role will also be trained in Operational cybersecurity, to act as required in relation to cybersecurity incident response. The Operational element will be approximately 20% of the role.

The successful applicant must be able to complete JCSC Cyber training

What will you do?

20% of the role will be the triage of line 1 security events and escalation to the Line two service of any validated events.Maintain and evolve the EGL cyber risk profile to ensure the organisation operates within an acceptable cyber risk appetite.Establish and maintain an internal team and set of internal relationships in support of the Cyber Security Strategy.Support business project delivery through providing line 1 cybersecurity risk advice as requiredWorks across the IT and trading teams to ensure appropriate focus on cyber risk management and appropriate prioritiesDrive continuous improvement via data analysis of risk and vulnerability findings.

Working with peers and reporting to the Chief Information Security Officer the identification, triage and management of cyber risk for EGL, covering;
Cyber related business risk
Network Security
End-user computing
Cloud computing
Hosting and storage


About you:
You will have an innovative mindset and enjoy working on greenfield projects as well as this you will have the ability to manage stakeholder relationships at all levels. Active in the Cyber community and enjoy looking for ways to update your current skill-set.

Understanding of business and industry direction, IT trends, key venUudors and their capabilities
Understanding of the technology landscape and who/how to engage
Demonstrated experience in Business Process & IT Systems


Desirable:
 Experience in large operational and/or Retail environment

Grow with Endeavour Drinks

Endeavour Drinks comprises a diverse range of drinks businesses including BWS, Dan Murphy’s, ALH and Pinnacle Drinks. We are focused on growing and transforming our businesses to meet the changing needs of customers and we’re driven by a culture that puts our customers and team first. Our ambition is to connect everyone with a drinks experience they'll love.
As an inclusive, team-first company, our people are at the core of everything we do.

We care deeply about creating a workplace where our team members feel valued, respected and empowered. We are committed to providing equal opportunity regardless of gender identity, ethnicity, disability or sexual orientation and we are proud to be recognised as a Gold Tier Employer in the Australian Workplace Equality Index for LGBTQ+ inclusion.
We value flexibility, and encourage our team members to work in ways that meet their work/life commitments and support their wellbeing.

We work hard to create a safe and inclusive environment for all, and most importantly, we're all about creating better experiences – for our customers and for each other.

We’d love to hear from You
If you meet a number of the requirements, but not all, we encourage you to submit your application. You can follow us on LinkedIn or see more opportunities via www.wowcareers.com.au. #Li #Work180"]

title: ['Analyst, Tech Service Support']
description:
["Work type: Permanent Full time
Location: Aust - VIC Metro

Outstanding opportunity to build and progress your career
Committed to working flexibly
Join a team that’s invested in you

A career that gives you more
Your career at NAB is about more than money, it's about serving our customers well and helping our communities prosper. We currently have an opportunity for an Analyst, Tech Service Support.

As we continue to work with new technology and expand our digital capabilities, we’re making everyday tasks simpler and quicker for our customers – leaving them more time for more important things. If you’re passionate about being part of an exciting operational team, you’re exactly the sort of person we’re looking for.

This role will take accountability for providing end-user support for the end-user computing services along with access management and field support when required. NAB provide onsite user support services and some field work may be required.

Key responsibilities:

Initial entry point for IMAC ((Installs, Moves, Adds, Changes) requests that require triage or client contact
End to End ownership of all request or incidents managed by IMAC & Incident & access management team
Responsible for meeting agreed KPI or SLA’s for requests assigned to achieve team targets.
Escalation of request or incident tickets to relevant support teams to ensure KPI or SLAs met
Provisioning of Standard / Non-standard and privileged accounts
Providing technical support of all facets of the Desktop environment, including Printer support
Implement and manage upgrades in SCCM
Use your Active Directory experience for support and implementation
Strong awareness and understanding of hardware, networks, software technologies and applications
knowledge in software distribution and patch management is desirable

What you will bring

While knowing the ins and outs of the latest technology is key, we’re also looking for someone with proven experience in Microsoft EUC based Workplace Technology and delivery. You will also have a strong background in the practical use, support and deployment of large-scale EUC environments and experience with Active Directory, UNIX/Linux account provisioning.

Working in a challenging, fast-paced environment, you’ll need drive, resilience and versatility. You’ll also be working with people from around the business, including key stakeholders, so a respectful attitude and the ability to build good relationships is vital.

You will be ambitious for growth; always curious and learning from colleagues. You will speak honestly, always valuing the time and opinion of others. You will own your work, doing what’s right, even when it’s hard.

By joining NAB, you are committing to putting our customers’ needs first every time. You will be ambitious for growth; always curious and learning from colleagues. You will speak honestly, always valuing the time and opinion of others. You will own your work, doing what’s right, even when it’s hard.

NAB, invested in you
We are committed to gender equality and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and have a diverse and inclusive workforce. We have committed $70bn in financing to help address climate change and provide 2 days of paid leave each year through our employee volunteering program to support community organisations.

We support our colleagues to be their best by offering a wide range of educational, financial, lifestyle, health & wellbeing benefits. For more information please visit here.

Join NAB

If you think this role is the right fit for you, we invite you to apply. Let’s explore who you are and what drives you. We’d love to share our vision for the future of banking.

To be eligible to apply, you must have Australian or New Zealand citizenship or permanent residency status. Please note candidate screening and interviews may be conducted prior to the closing date of the job advert.
Please note unsolicited CVs from agencies will not be accepted"]

title: ['Performance Reporting Analyst / BI Analyst']
description:
['There’s never been a better time to be at AGL
At AGL, we believe progress is powered by our people.
If you’re set on making real change for tomorrow, we have the scale, resources and ambition to get it started today.
Now’s an extraordinary time to work with us. We’re taking the lead on renewables and expanding our products to make them more sustainable, affordable and useful for all Australians.
That’s what we call progress. To achieve it, we’re bringing together people with unique stories, perspectives, backgrounds and talent – and we need yours too!
About the Role
Drive automation of reporting and utilisation of data visualisation tools
Advanced user: Power BI, Excel & PowerPoint
Permanent opportunity based in Melbourne or Sydney
The Enterprise Services Reporting, Data & Analytics team provides reporting and insights to support a broad range of stakeholders across Enterprise Services and AGL. There are three focus areas to the team:
Master data - Are custodians of vendor and material master data creation and maintenance
Performance reporting - Provide a centre-led service to the broader Enterprise Services team and business through the development of key performance metrics, reporting solutions and facilitation of high-quality reporting on activities
Third party commercial insights - Provide analytical and decision support to Enterprise Services and the business on third party commercial issues affecting the business. These include strategic initiatives, projects and identification of value opportunities
The Performance Reporting Analyst is principally responsible for the following:
Performing analysis of AGL’s Enterprise Services’ teams and providing meaningful insights into performance metrics and KPIs, contributing to the achievement of Enterprise Services goals
Automate reporting to enable accessibility, timely and accurate insights to drive decision making
What you’ll be doing:
Developing and maintaining reports utilising data visualisation tools (Power BI)
Promoting self-service functionality and providing feedback to enhancement of SAP tools
Assisting in the preparation of the monthly Enterprise Services reports & monthly variance analysis on performance metrics including savings targets, compliance, Accounts Payable and Purchasing metrics, work on a range of ad hoc reporting and initiatives as required
Ensuring governance is achieved by reporting and monitoring adherence to Enterprise Services policies and standards
Coordinating and consolidating PT3 benefits reporting & social license reporting
Ownership of tools, dashboards and techniques to improve performance management and spend visibility
Business partnering with key stakeholders and teams across the Procure-to-Pay value chain and Enterprise Services to build out meaningful insights based on metrics reported
Training staff on dashboards and reporting tools
Assisting Manager Reporting, Data & Analytics as required
About You
What you’ll bring to the table:
Demonstrated previous experience in a similar Performance Analyst / BI Analyst role in a complex corporate environment, synthesising and presenting insights to stakeholders
Experience working/reporting in a shared service, procure-to-pay environment preferred
Advanced Power BI, Excel & PowerPoint skills essential, with previous exposure to SAP S4
Excellent written and verbal communication skills and strong business acumen
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with proven ability to interact with and maintain effective relationships across diverse stakeholder groups
Demonstrated problem solving skills with strong attention to detail
We’d love to see your application, submitted by this date: 6th December 2020.
Reach out to Greg Higginbotham, Recruitment Partner if you have any questions via: ghigginbotham @agl.com.au .
At AGL all employees are encouraged to be themselves and to bring their whole selves to work every day. We encourage applications from Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander people, people living with disability, culturally and linguistically diverse people and people of the LGBTQ+ community, including transgender, gender diverse, and intersex people. AGL has a commitment to maintain a diverse workforce, so welcomes the opportunity for applicants to share their lived experiences but recognises that some applicants may not wish to disclose, so that option is supported.
Please note - unsolicited resumes from agencies will not be accepted by AGL.
Job Family Group:
Finance and Accounting']

title: ['Data Analyst']
description:
["About us:
We’re known for being the country’s most popular rewards program, making the everyday worth more for millions of Aussies. But 26 years of success and growth doesn’t happen by keeping up the status quo.
All the things that make working at Flybuys different as usual – these aren't just values we talk about. They’re built into everything we do, every day.
Be part of a company that's always questioned the norm. A business that's well-established, but still expanding. With one eye on the horizon.
And together we can make every day different as usual.
Your Team:
We've already built a pretty amazing team, but we're not looking for more of the same. Our day-to-day is made stronger when we surround ourselves with people who are different, like you.
We work really hard to build teams that support each other. It’s the kind of environment you’ll miss while you’re on holidays.
Your Role:
There is no typical working week at Flybuys. But here are some of the things you might be working on, day-to-day;
Work with Analytics and Commercial teams to articulate the customer opportunity, commercial benefit, analytical findings.
Respond to requests from partners and Commercial team in a timely fashion, providing accurate, QC'd analysis and findings.
Have input on workload prioritisation, with informed view of relative value of each analytics request.
Showcase, benchmark and quantify the value and outcomes of analytics based decision making.
Translate complex mathematical techniques into consumable and commercial concepts, with a focus on promoting the value of the flybuys program.
Participate in planning with key customers to create a joined up vision and deliverables.
Source, develop and apply new and existing analytical methods and techniques.
Use of a variety of sources to keep abreast of industry practices.
Ensure key stakeholders are updated, ensuring the commercial impact has been explored / communicate.
Your Experience:
Tertiary Qualified in Business, Mathematics or Science discipline.
Analytics professional with a proven track record, (minimum 3 years working experience)
Experience in Campaign, Digital and Reporting analytics - from planning to post campaign analysis.
Great influencing and storytelling skills and the ability to navigate internal and external organisations to build and leverage relationships.
Experience in clearly articulating commercial benefits of analytics.
Naturally collaborative with a strong emphasis on building and leveraging relationships both internally and externally.
Experience of large, complex data sets.
Naturally curious, able to positively challenge existing practices.
Experience of analytical tools – data extraction, data exploration and analysis, data visualisation.
Experience of working within large, complex, cross functional projects .
Technical skills including Oracle SQL, R, BI experience (e.g.Tableau, MicroStrategy)
Experience with Snowflake would be advantageous.
We value ways of working that work for everyone, and use our different strengths to make us stronger.
We work hard to make sure everyone’s voice is heard and respected equally, regardless of identity, background, position, ability or lifestyle.
So whether you’re an earlybird list maker, a night owl coder, a brainstorm chaser or a PowerPoint proof-reader, we want you to Be You, With Us."]

title: ['Budget and Reporting Analyst']
description:
["
$86,558 to $98,210 (Plus Superannuation)
Ongoing
Usual hours of work: Full Time (flexibility may be available)
Usual work location: 1 Spring Street, Melbourne (flexibility may be available)

The position of Budget and Reporting Analyst forms a part of the Investment and Procurement Branch within the Corporate Services Group.
The Investment and Procurement Branch provides strategic advice and professional services to the business and our Ministers, creating value by improving performance and sustainability across the DJPR portfolios in line with its objectives.
The Budget and Reporting Analyst supports the implementation and uptake of the Oracle Cloud Financial System's Enterprise Performance Management Module (EMP) within the Department.
The Budget and Reporting Analyst will be responsible for building new management reports utilising EMP, developing and maintaining user guidance materials and providing tailored support and advice to end users to maximise benefits realised. The Budget and Reporting Analyst will also support the Manager EPM to review and enhance the EPM module and associated processes and policies, provide tools to enable informed decision making, and improve reporting and financial management capability across the department.
Reporting to the Manager, Enterprise Performance Management the key accountabilities of the role include:


Advance the implementation and uptake of the Enterprise Performance Management (EPM) module within the Department's Oracle Cloud System including by:
building new management reports utilising EMP;
developing and maintaining user guidance materials;
supporting the implementation of system updates.
Provide tailored support and advice to end users to maximise benefits realised from the EPM. Identify common issues and solutions and translate findings into new guidance materials, training and/or system refinements.
Support the Manager EPM to monitor the ongoing and emerging budgeting, reporting and forecasting requirements of the department and provide advice on the need for refinement of the EPM and/or department processes.
Demonstrate advanced financial expertise to routinely advise/explain complex concepts, ideas and issues to colleagues and managers.
Establish and maintain effective, strategic and collaborative relationships with stakeholders within the department in order to manage risks, resolve issues and drive improvement in budgeting, reporting and forecasting.

For a confidential discussion, please call Daniel Rodger, Director Strategy and Investment on 0428 039 561.
Successful candidates will be required to undergo a National Police Records Check prior to commencing employment with the Department
For further information on the position, please refer to the attached position description.
How to Apply
Please click the ‘Apply Now' button. As part of the application process, you will provide responses to the following two questions in your cover letter:


Give an example of how you've used your budgeting and financial analysis skills to either improve a process or financial system in order to facilitate budget and financial advice to management.
Please outline your experience in implementing a new system or process in the workplace; what approach did you take and how did you ensure acceptance from stakeholders.

Applications close at midnight on 2 December 2020"]

title: ['Fraud Analyst']
description:
['About the role
Our Fraud Analysts identify and assess fraud risks associated with new products and processes across Latitude Financial Services as well as the identification of improvement opportunities related to fraud.
You will be responsible for;
Assist in identifying areas of in-efficiency in the fraud department and work with relevant teams to ensure that improvements are made.
Ensure that fraud processes and policies are adhered to and that adequate monitoring is in place to identify any potential anomalies, including systems governance and internal fraud
Review functional and business specifications to ensure that any systems/process changes that may lead to a fraud impact are communicated
Conducting timely and articulate assessments of fraud risk associated with new projects/processes ensuring that business is aware and prepared for any changes that may impact fraud.
What will you be doing?
You will be driving and facilitating the continued optimisation of Fraud Prevention Systems by way of Rule reviews, Trend analysis and Customer & Fraudster Profiling. This role will also see you provide targeted commentary of Fraud Loss and Prevention results both internally and externally.
Monitor and communicate volume and quality metrics for operational fraud teams ensuring an effective outcome for the business.
Interpret data outputs of confirmed Fraud Incidents and translate these into prevention strategies.
Assist in the forecasting of fraud exposure and losses.
Assist in the implementation and analysis of new Fraud Prevention products as they become available.
Drive the communication of new/improved system and process strategies to wider fraud department.
About you
You are an experienced analyst who is passionate and interested in the financial crime industry, you understands not only who the "bad-guys" are but who are awesome customers are and how to best look after them.
Demonstrable experience with SAS, SQL or equivalent coding experience eg: Python, R
Ability to work in a dynamic environment where priorities can change frequently.
Ability to maintain high standards of accuracy and work under pressure to achieve deadlines.
Sound like you?

That’s a good sign! In return for your energy and ideas we offer genuine flexible family life / work balance e.g. adjusted days, hours. Health, well-being and social initiatives to help you feel great and connected, as well as our hugely popular extra week of leave program.


We always support a safe, healthy, engaging and productive working environment for all employees and workers, whether that be in your home an office or a combination of both. We live and breathe our values. Act Right, Show Care, Be Curious


Partners in money

Latitude may seem like the new kid on the block, but it’s taken us almost a hundred years to become an overnight success. Digital payments, cards, loans and insurance is what we offer - but what we really are is a platform that helps people shop and live better.


Successful applicants will be required to complete a background check (including criminal history and bankruptcy check) prior to commencement of employment. Only open to Australian or New Zealand Permanent Residents or Citizens']

title: ['Business Analyst']
description:
["Location: Melbourne, VIC, AU
Company: metrotrain
Metro is a multi-award winning organisation, and we pride ourselves on our team of honest, high performing professionals who are talented, inclusive and safety focused and who are at the core of our success. You will be joining an organisation that is known as a global leader in its field but also prides itself on being dynamic, embracing new technologies and focused on customer service. Our aim is to promote work/life balance, allow team members to bring their best to work and to truly be focused on a common goal which is to provide a world-class railway service.

Position
Establishing the business improvement initiatives by collaborating with the Compliance and Reporting Manager. The Business Analyst will be a crucial member of the OCMS team by helping the business deliver our commercial obligations to state.

This opportunity is likely to extend after 12 months if someone who has proven knowledge across systems, processes and change to helpdevelop and drive solutions across OCMS relating to State compliance and reporting activities.

Responsibilities

Investigate business requirements using a range of tools and techniques including interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, scenarios, business analysis and task/workflow analysis.
Familiarise with enterprise asset and financial management systems with ability to extract and analyse information to support systematic change and associated reporting.
Identify and interview relevant stakeholders who may have an interest in, or may be affected by, the problem or solution; complete stakeholder impact analyses; facilitate group workshops where necessary.
Collaborate with developers and subject matter experts to establish the business and technical solution designs (including to-be business processes), bearing in mind trade-offs between usability, performance and time/cost to deliver.
Facilitate open communication and discussion between stakeholders, using feedback to assess and promote understanding of the need for future changes in services, products and systems. Act as liaison between the Business Units, technology teams and support teams.
Develop and execute change and communications strategies and plans
Successfully engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously.
Plan and facilitate project workshops – e.g. problem definition, stakeholder analysis, risk analysis, implementation planning, etc.
Develop a deep understanding of the MTM organisational context, structure and operation.
Analyse business needs of a more strategic/complex nature, requiring a deeper understanding of MTM and with significant impact across the organisation.
Provide business analysis “practice leadership” in terms of coaching and mentoring other business analysts; contributing to improving business analysis processes, tools and templates, QA of other business analysts’ work as required, etc.
Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, deconstruct complex information into more easily accessible details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs.


About You

A relevant postgraduate qualification with 5+ years’ relevant experience, or an equivalent combination of relevant experience and/or education/training
Demonstrated extensive ability to identify and assess stakeholders needs, support and best approach to engage strategically to achieve project goals and objectives
Experience in supervising and managing staff through effective leadership and managing performance at a team level
Demonstrated ability to promote best practice through mentoring, coaching of other business analysts
Benefits
All Metro Employees receive a free Myki pass that allows free Public Transport in Victoria
Metro supports work/life balance with opportunities to work from home on occasion
Have a great impact on programs that will directly improve Melbourne’s suburban rail network whilst ensuring these developments do not come as a cost to our safe and cost-effective delivery of services


How to apply
Please submit your application by clicking ‘Apply Now’ before 4th December 2020

Metro Trains is an equal opportunity employer and embraces diversity. We encourage all interested applicants to apply but please note only applications with the right to live and work in Australia will be considered for this position.


This is a fantastic opportunity to build on the career you've developed to date and take it to the next level by making a tangible impact that matters.
If what you’ve read resonates with your values, experience and career aspiration then we want to hear from you!

Metro Trains is an equal opportunity employer and embraces diversity. We encourage all interested applicants to apply but please do note only applications with the right to live and work in Australia will be considered for this position."]

title: ['Test Analyst']
description:
["Job no: 495298
Work type: Permanent Full time
Location: Melbourne
Categories: Information Technology

Dedicated to delivering a superior experience to customers Hydro Tasmania is a successful, vibrant player in the energy industry and is Australia's largest producer of renewable energy. Continuing growth, excellent working conditions and career opportunities make Hydro Tasmania and its subsidiaries Momentum and Entura a great place to work.

About the role:

Reporting to the GM Retail IT, your role as the Test Analyst is to provide efficient and effective quality system testing to ensure business requirements are met, and systems adhere to all regulatory requirements. In this role will focus on quality/testing execution in line with the Quality Management strategy, including working towards test automation.

About you and your experience:

To be successful in this role you will be able to demonstrate your Technical capability in ISTQB Advanced Level Test Analyst/Technical Test Analyst (Preferred) as well as Demonstrated experience within a software test environment along with exposure to commercial development of software and experience in business focussed test environments and end-to-end IT applications testing

You will have a Tertiary qualifications in IT such as Software engineering and have experience with Salesforce and other Digital technologies, experience in working with Cloud infrastructure (AWS) and associated services and Extensive integration (testing) experience in a complex environment.

Application Instructions:

To apply for this position, attach your resume and cover letter detailing why you are the most suitable person for the role.

Applications close 5pm Wednesday 16th December 2020.
Advertised: 18 Nov 2020 AUS Eastern Daylight Time
Applications close: 16 Dec 2020 AUS Eastern Daylight Time"]

title: ['Planning and Reporting Analyst']
description:
['About the role
The Planning and Reporting Analyst works within the Planning and Risk Management team and is responsible for developing and producing management reports to meet the requirements of managers and other users of reports. The role is also responsible for developing and implementing data analytics to identify and analyse exceptions, trends and other relevant insights into financial data to provide advice to senior management. The Finance and Risk team have established finance reporting, the successful applicant will improve user friendliness of extracting information from available data and will present it in a visually appealing way.
The Planning and Reporting Analyst also provides advice to Members of Parliament and electorate officers on their budget expenditure in accordance with the relevant legislation and guidelines. This role supports the Senior Budget and Risk Analyst with the State budget process and external reporting requirements.
About you
To be successful in this role you will have proven experience in using data analytics and reporting tools with large financial management systems, such as Oracle. You will have skills and experience in extracting and visually presenting useful trends from large datasets. You will have experience in using a diverse range of reporting tools and will be able to review our data, and suggest and implement relevant tools and programs to analyse and present data. You will have experience in coordinating projects with input from variety of stakeholders at different levels of the organisation.
Your ability to interpret and apply legislative requirements, including Accounting Standards and related financial legislations, will be a strength.
You are a strong communicator and demonstrate the ability to communicate with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Qualification or proven experience in data analytics is desirable.
Why join us?
The Parliament of Victoria is committed to providing employees with flexible working conditions to support our employees in balancing their work and life commitments. You may also be eligible for annual discounts on various personal utilities, including myki pass and private health insurance.
Your professional development is important to us, that's why we have a dedicated learning and development framework, along with leadership development programs and targeted in-house training.
Whether you're working in the iconic heritage listed Parliament House building or in our adjacent open-plan, modern offices you'll have easy access to public transport, Melbourne's top retailers, cafes and restaurants, along with other lifestyle attractions available on the unique Collins Street and Spring Street precincts.
How to Apply
Using the "Apply Now" button, please respond to our questions in the application, include your resume and brief cover letter (1-2 pages) broadly outlining your experience in line with the Key Selection Criteria contained within the position description']

title: ['Senior Sonata Administration Analyst']
description:
['Mercer is seeking candidates for the following position based in Melbourne:

Senior Sonata Administration Analyst
What can you expect:
To provide support to the Administration team on complex issues including benefit and insurance design, legislative requirements, fund and reserve setup and administration as they relate to the Sonata registry system
The role includes working on best practice methodology, process improvement and involvement in project management where required
Providing technical direction and coaching on the use of Sonata to the Administration team
Troubleshooting administration inquiries in relation to Sonata
What is in it for you:
35 hour working week
Leading training and development program
Flexibility
Professional environment where your career path really matters and is supported in our global organisation
Great team environment with energetic and supportive colleagues
We will count on you to:
Act as a Subject Matter Expert on change initiatives and remediation of work as they relate to Sonata
Analyze Sonata issues, understand impacts and propose resolution options as well as support fix effort
Assess current manual processes and identify opportunities to streamline processes or automate
Provide support for the daily Sonata administration processes as a decision maker and escalation point
Supervise and assist in completion of complex administration and fund level tasks on Sonata
Meet all compliance requirements
Manage the investigation and scoping of Sonata rectification work through to completion
Perform peer review of any complex and non-standard processing on Sonata, and respond to complex inquiries
Providing guidance and coaching for experienced members of the team
Project confidence when communicating with both internal and external stakeholders regarding Sonata processes and issues
What you need to have:
Superannuation experience – ideally at least 2 years
In depth knowledge of Sonata registry system
Excellent analytical skills
Strong organisation and planning skills
Ability to work independently
Excellent knowledge of superannuation legislation and insurance within superannuation
Good communication skills
Strong coaching skills
About us:
Mercer builds brighter futures by redefining the world of work, reshaping retirement and investment outcomes, and unlocking real health and well-being. Mercer’s more than 25,000 employees are based in 44 countries and the firm operates in over 130 countries. Mercer is a business of Marsh & McLennan (NYSE: MMC), the world’s leading professional services firm in the areas of risk, strategy and people, with 75,000 colleagues and annualized revenue approaching $17 billion. Through its market-leading businesses including Marsh, Guy Carpenter and Oliver Wyman, Marsh & McLennan helps clients navigate an increasingly dynamic and complex environment. For more information, visit www.mercer.com. Follow Mercer on Twitter @Mercer.
Mercer is an equal opportunity employer committed to embracing a diverse, inclusive and flexible work environment. We aim to attract and retain the best people regardless of their sex (including intersex), marital/parental status, ethnic origin, nationality, age, background, disability, sexual orientation and gender identity.
Please apply using the link below, applications will only be considered from candidates who have the appropriate approval to work in Australia. Successful applicants will be required to complete a Criminal & Bankruptcy check prior to commencement of employment.']

title: ['Java Analyst']
description:
['JOB DESCRIPTION

Technology Analyst (JL4)
About Infosys:

Infosys is a global leader in next-generation digital services and consulting. We enable clients in 46 countries to navigate their digital transformation. With over three decades of experience in managing the systems and workings of global enterprises, we expertly steer our clients through their digital journey. We do it by enabling the enterprise with an AI-powered core that helps prioritize the execution of change. We also empower the business with agile digital at scale to deliver unprecedented levels of performance and customer delight. Our always-on learning agenda drives their continuous improvement through building and transferring digital skills, expertise, and ideas from our innovation ecosystem.

Visit www.infosys.com to see how Infosys (NYSE: INFY) can help your enterprise navigate your next.

Location: Sydney

Short Description:
5+ years total hand-on experience
Experience in corporate environment
Technical skillset
MANDATORY
Java & J2EE
Spring (Core, MVC, Boot), JPA/Hibernate
React JS
Micro services design, development and deployments.
Build & automation tools – Maven, Jenkins or Teamcity.
Source control tools – Github or BitBucket.
Amazon Web Services (Ec2 and Lambda).
Experience in Agile methodologies.

NICE TO HAVE
Test driven development (TDD) – Junit, Mockito, RestAssured ,Cucumber.
AEM(Adobe Enterprise Manager)
Cache Frameworks – Redis
python
MS Azure
CI/CD – Jenkins, Docker
Apache Kafka, Apache Camel
