title: ['Data Insights Analyst']
description:
['Join the world leader in legal automation and legal innovation
Come help us challenge the status-quo
Simplify our metrics, help us dig into our data to deliver actionable insights


The Role:


The Data Insights Analyst manages and coordinates the activities to support data-driven decisions made by Plexus. You are the owner of the data layer ensuring the key metrics that drive growth are simple and that each team has access to these metrics on demand and has integrity.


You will have a passion and curiosity for developing, interpreting, and generating business insights to support the Plexus team in delivering 100% year on year growth.


You will work with teams to simplify the metrics and build beautiful visualizations of key metrics using Power BI and associated tools. As this is a new capability for the organisation you will need to drive the architecture of the data ecosystem and toolset selection.

In more detail you will:
Support the Plexus leaders to develop and simplify the key metrics that drive growth
Define the governance structure for data and work with stakeholders to define metrics and map business logic
Develop data models to report on key metrics to deliver insights and incorporate predictive analysis to support growth
Analyse data and provide internal and external customers with clearly communicated insights
Visualise beautiful dashboards using Power BI.
Think outside the current reporting and process. Leverage the existing or new tools to deliver innovative solutions
Create plans to extend and develop insights and observations. i.e. Challenge convention with data
Learn new methods, techniques and advocate for new tools and explain the benefits to the team / business
Desired Outcomes:
Create and manage a simple set of north star metrics for the business along with sub metrics for each team & product line
Create and manage our data governance framework incorporating data models with clear definitions agreed for each metric
Build beautiful reports/dashboards generated for Plexus and each of the teams
Establish a data partnering model with key stakeholders
Generate actionable insights and present to Senior Leadership Team
Create roadmap for data insights capability
Key Capabilities:
Build data models and reports
Experience in Power BI/Power Pivot
Visualization and storytelling skills
SAAS or Product business preferred
Data governance
Stakeholder management
Business Analysis
Best practice techniques
Core Attributes:
Curious
Storytelling
Pragmatic
Problem-solving ability
Systematic and logical
Passion for learning
Commercial acumen']

title: ['Replenishment Analyst']
description:
["Job no: 935184
Work type: Permanent / Full time
Location: Support Office - Docklands

Work is a whole lot better when you love what you do, we know that. That’s why we make sure that the loves and interests of our people match their responsibilities. We take what they love, and we let them live it.
So, do you want to be part of a team who loves coming to work each day? A team that makes Myer a great place to shop, and an even greater place to work?

As a Replenishment Analyst for Entertainment, you will play a pivotal role in delivering the end-to-end management of merchandise replenishment and strategic product planning. A part of the Merchandise team, you will have the exciting opportunity to collaborate with the wider team and key stakeholders, ensuring customer demand has been met, both in-store and online.

Opportunity to be a part of and execute special projects
Make an impact within a dynamic and collaborative team
Ongoing training and development for your progression

About The Role:

Management of supplier purchase orders from tracking, follow up and communication
Ensuring the accuracy of system generated orders and driving best practice
Monitor and track product performance, providing your specialist advice to the business for post-season reviews
Directly liaising with suppliers, stores and key stakeholders to effectively execute seamless replenishment processes
Managing the setting of replenishment parameters, delivering efficiency when replenishing merchandise through the supply chain
Strategic thinking and forecasting, providing appropriate product planning support and utilisation for the merchandise team
Adhering to the critical timelines of the demand planning and replenishment critical path

About You:

Previous experience in stock management or replenishment (retail preferred)
Intermediate computer technology and systems skills, particularly Microsoft Excel
A strategic thinker with the ability to forecast, as well as obtaining a strong financial, analytical and business acumen
A confident professional with the ability to influence a team, leaders and key stakeholders
Able to positively contribute to a dynamic team, being a flexible and adaptable team player
Strong time management skills with the ability to effectively prioritize and drive efficiency
Bachelors degree or qualifications in Business Analytics, Commerce, Logistics/Supply Chain, Finance or Merchandise (advantageous but not essential)

The Benefits:

Generous team member discounts on all Myer products
The experience to work alongside industry pioneers
Ongoing training and development for your career progression
The opportunity to be a part of and contribute to the Myer growth strategy

If you are ready to make your mark within Australia's Largest Department store, don't miss this opportunity.

APPLY NOW!

Aust. Working Rights: To be eligible to apply for this job, you must have Australian working rights. For further information contact the Australian Department of Immigration.

Equal Opp. Employer: We pride ourselves on the diversity of the people who work at Myer, representing the community in which we serve.

Agency note: Myer Pty Ltd does not accept unsolicited resumes/candidate profiles from external agencies or suppliers via any method. Any candidates submitted in an unsolicited manner, will be considered a direct candidate application to Myer and no fee will be payable.
Applications close: 27 Nov 2020 AUS Eastern Daylight Time"]

title: ['Systems Analyst']
description:
['Line of Service
Assurance
Industry/Sector
Not Applicable
Specialism
Assurance
Management Level
Associate
Job Description & Summary
With PwC, you’ll ignite a meaningful career while being supported by a flexible working culture, innovative learning and development opportunities and progressive policies and benefits, such as 18 weeks paid parental leave for mums, dads and foster carers (no minimum service!)
What will you create?
You’ll help Australian businesses, not-for-profits and governments create value and improve the way they work. From digitising healthcare, to creating smarter cities and igniting our start-up industry, together we build trust in society and solve important problems.
Trust and Risk bring this to life by helping clients to protect and strengthen every aspect of their business; from people to performance, systems to strategy and business plans to business resilience.
As an Systems Analyst our Technology Risk team your impact will be seen by:
Being responsible for anticipating and identifying risks and raise issues with line management to support our commitment to risk and quality.
Preparing and reviewing of financial statements
Analysing and documenting of internal controls and control Environments
Knowing all aspects of audit and statutory reporting
About you
You have a background in a technology controls environment and are skilled in IT general control (ITGC) reviews, automated controls, system-generated reports, internal audits and service organisation controls reports. You hold an understanding of the complexity around technology issues and how to solve them from strategy to execution.
Passionate about being at the forefront of change, you’re ready to help our Risk Assurance practice transform how risk is perceived and capitalised on.
You’re collaborative and enjoy working in an innovative environment. You’re a problem solver by nature and want to join a firm that values the kind of people who reimagine the possible for their clients and stakeholders. Most importantly, you act with integrity and show care for the people you work with.
Life at PwC
Our culture and benefits are something we’re proud of, and also the reason we’ve been named LinkedIn’s #1 Australian workplace. With PwC, you’ll belong to an inclusive community where differences are both embraced and the underlying driver in everything we create together.
We empower you with the technology, coaching, flexibility and trust needed to make a meaningful difference, while supporting you in bringing your whole self to work each day. We’re committed to building and maintaining a diverse workforce because we know it’s only by working together that we can realise the potential of our people, clients and society around us.
We’re living this commitment through initiatives including our Reconciliation Action Plan to increase Indigenous employment and employee-led diversity networks promoting cultural, disability, LGBTI and gender equality. At our core we’re a people business, which means you’ll be supported not just in your professional development but your personal growth as well.
Wiona Court is the Recruitment Manager for the role. As the team experience high volumes of applications, we appreciate your patience to allow for a timely and fair process for all.
We welcome the opportunity to speak to candidates about our value proposition and recognition and reward approach. The minimum full time salary for this role is $68,000 including 9.5% Superannuation, however will be determined based on the skills and experience that the candidate brings. #LI-PWCLMT

title: ['Business Analyst']
description:
["Location: Melbourne, VIC, AU
Company: metrotrain
Metro is a multi-award winning organisation, and we pride ourselves on our team of honest, high performing professionals who are talented, inclusive and safety focused and who are at the core of our success. You will be joining an organisation that is known as a global leader in its field but also prides itself on being dynamic, embracing new technologies and focused on customer service. Our aim is to promote work/life balance, allow team members to bring their best to work and to truly be focused on a common goal which is to provide a world-class railway service.

Position
Establishing the business improvement initiatives by collaborating with the Compliance and Reporting Manager. The Business Analyst will be a crucial member of the OCMS team by helping the business deliver our commercial obligations to state.

This opportunity is likely to extend after 12 months if someone who has proven knowledge across systems, processes and change to helpdevelop and drive solutions across OCMS relating to State compliance and reporting activities.

Responsibilities

Investigate business requirements using a range of tools and techniques including interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, scenarios, business analysis and task/workflow analysis.
Familiarise with enterprise asset and financial management systems with ability to extract and analyse information to support systematic change and associated reporting.
Identify and interview relevant stakeholders who may have an interest in, or may be affected by, the problem or solution; complete stakeholder impact analyses; facilitate group workshops where necessary.
Collaborate with developers and subject matter experts to establish the business and technical solution designs (including to-be business processes), bearing in mind trade-offs between usability, performance and time/cost to deliver.
Facilitate open communication and discussion between stakeholders, using feedback to assess and promote understanding of the need for future changes in services, products and systems. Act as liaison between the Business Units, technology teams and support teams.
Develop and execute change and communications strategies and plans
Successfully engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously.
Plan and facilitate project workshops – e.g. problem definition, stakeholder analysis, risk analysis, implementation planning, etc.
Develop a deep understanding of the MTM organisational context, structure and operation.
Analyse business needs of a more strategic/complex nature, requiring a deeper understanding of MTM and with significant impact across the organisation.
Provide business analysis “practice leadership” in terms of coaching and mentoring other business analysts; contributing to improving business analysis processes, tools and templates, QA of other business analysts’ work as required, etc.
Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, deconstruct complex information into more easily accessible details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs.


About You

A relevant postgraduate qualification with 5+ years’ relevant experience, or an equivalent combination of relevant experience and/or education/training
Demonstrated extensive ability to identify and assess stakeholders needs, support and best approach to engage strategically to achieve project goals and objectives
Experience in supervising and managing staff through effective leadership and managing performance at a team level
Demonstrated ability to promote best practice through mentoring, coaching of other business analysts
Benefits
All Metro Employees receive a free Myki pass that allows free Public Transport in Victoria
Metro supports work/life balance with opportunities to work from home on occasion
Have a great impact on programs that will directly improve Melbourne’s suburban rail network whilst ensuring these developments do not come as a cost to our safe and cost-effective delivery of services


How to apply
Please submit your application by clicking ‘Apply Now’ before 4th December 2020

Metro Trains is an equal opportunity employer and embraces diversity. We encourage all interested applicants to apply but please note only applications with the right to live and work in Australia will be considered for this position.


This is a fantastic opportunity to build on the career you've developed to date and take it to the next level by making a tangible impact that matters.
If what you’ve read resonates with your values, experience and career aspiration then we want to hear from you!

Metro Trains is an equal opportunity employer and embraces diversity. We encourage all interested applicants to apply but please do note only applications with the right to live and work in Australia will be considered for this position."]

title: ['Data Analyst']
description:
["Requisition Title -
Data Analyst
Job Number: - AUS121205
Description

Senior Data Analyst/Pricing Manager
Role Location: Melbourne
Role Type: Data Analyst permanent
At ANZ our purpose is to shape a world where people and communities thrive and to achieve this, we need a talented Senior Data Analyst to join our Payments and Merchant Tribe. The Payments and Merchant Tribe's mission is to enable customers to pay and get paid more simply, reliably and cost-effectively.
Our data analysts deeply understand the power of data to generate quality customer insights, manage information and identify trends to accelerate sound business decisions.
Your skillset will enable you to source and interrogate data, working with a focus on the future, with an active understanding of industry trends to ensure capability development is aligned. You will influence strategic direction by translating insights into practical business recommendations, communicating team objectives and presenting data in digestible, logical and compelling ways.
This is a critical role within Payments & Merchant Services Tribe will have key responsibilities including:
Analysis and implementation of pricing changes in-line with scheme mandates and other strategic initiatives.
Develop understanding of merchant acquiring pricing structures and landscape.
Development of forecasting reports, models and insights to demonstrate portfolio impact of various pricing strategy and changes.
Data analysis and insights development to support all other strategic pricing, merchant and BAU initiatives.
Design and development of capabilities and tools to support the tribe with data and insights to enable agile and rapid response to merchant and pricing initiatives.
Provide input and assist in systems design, development and testing for business initiatives.
Support and assist with data analysis and data extract requests across the tribe.
Promote portfolio pricing standards and pricing opportunities with stakeholders.

What will your day look like?
Analyse, review and implement pricing changes and ensuring the integrity and accuracy of data.
Leverage data sets and develop insights to support various merchant acquisition, attrition and pricing initiatives.
Ensuring adherence to ANZ legal, regulatory and other external compliance obligations through data and insights.
Supporting business initiatives by providing input and support to system design and testing.
Design and develop processes, tools and capabilities to mitigate and eliminate operational risks.
Presenting data and insights to the broader team and tribe to enable data-driven decision making.

What will be in your toolkit?
Advanced skills in SQL (Oracle PL/SQL, Teradata) and Excel
Strong communication skills and adept at providing insights in business-friendly language.
Domain experience in pricing and/or merchant acquiring preferable.
Familiarity with data visualisation/business intelligence tools (QlikSense) will be advantageous.
Demonstrate a strong sense of accountability and attention to detail in delivering the outcome required by business.
Ability to take a consultative approach in working with multiple stakeholders across various ANZ teams.

About ANZ
We’re reinventing the way we do banking, and our community of collaborative, innovative thinkers who create human centred solutions are helping us get there. We’re responding faster to changing customer requirements, focusing on the things that matter and helping people achieve incredible things – be it buying their home, building a business or saving for things big or small.
We support our people by providing a range of flexible working options so they can work in the way that best suits them. We encourage you to talk to us about your need for flexibility and any adjustments you may require to our recruitment process or the role itself.
We’ll also offer you the opportunity to develop your career, working in a diverse and inclusive workplace where the different backgrounds, perspectives and life experiences of our people are celebrated and create a great place to grow, thrive and belong.
Interested in joining us? Click Apply now, or visit www.anz.com/careers to find out more or view other opportunities.
Reference number: AUS121205

title: ['Service Desk Analyst']
['Analyst - Deloitte Managed Solutions']
description:
['Date: 10-Nov-2020

Location:
Melbourne, VIC, AU Sydney, NSW, AU Brisbane, QLD, AU

Department:Description:
Analyst

Multiple opportunities in our Managed Solutions team
Hybrid working environment across multiple locations.
Deloitte Flex - We recognise the importance of balance and embrace agility

What will your typical day look like?

Join our Deloitte Managed Solutions (DMS) team as we support our clients in responding to their most important and complex business needs, operating bespoke delivery programs with quality, speed and efficiency across a wide range of industries and sectors. No two days are the same but typical daily activities could include:

Provide operational support to business proposals and engagement activity across our existing or new clients in response to important and complex client issues.
Help lead the execution of our programs through structured problem solving, effective time management and providing our teams with the support and guidance needed to deliver high quality outcomes efficiently and effectively.
Providing project and client operational reporting, such as performance and status/forecast reporting.
Working in a fast-paced, target-driven environments, whilst maintaining composure in dealing with complex and challenging operational issues.
Support resourcing and operational requirements to scale-up our large-scale programs.
Thrive in a multi-disciplinary team environment and adopt different working styles to meet different approaches in our work
Involvement in the preparation of operational financial management tools and budgets.
Build authentic and trusted relationships with our teams and the broader Deloitte firm.

About the team

The financial services industry and other industries and sectors are facing significant headwinds responding to misconduct which has resulted in a loss of customer trust and reputational damage. Organisations have responded by setting up large scale remediation programs and at Deloitte, through our DMS practice, we support our clients in re-building trust and delivering confidence on issues that matter most.

Our vision is to assist our clients with important and complex issues and challenges: typically, in delivering large scale complex and bespoke delivery programs, often in short timescales, bringing our expertise and excellence in execution to help our clients respond to their issues, with quality, speed and efficiency.

Enough about us, let’s talk about you. You are someone with:
1 - 2 years financial services industry experience across any of the following: Retail Banking/Wholesale/Investments/Banking/ Insurance/Super/lending/credit or Public sector experience
A proven track record delivering or being involved in large-scale operational projects, investigations or remedial reviews;
Strong technical skills relating to process mapping, Excel, Visio and other operational I.T. skills
Effective communication and interpersonal skills
Enthusiasm and a passion to succeed
Experience of change management in terms of an operational context and an ability to work easily in a transitional period

Why Deloitte?

At Deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. We value difference and embrace people with diverse backgrounds and thinking styles. Knowing that people work best in different ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated.']

title: ['Analyst, Data Engineering']
description:
["Work type: Permanent Full time
Location: Aust - VIC Metro

A career that gives you more.

You will be joining a cohesive and collaborative engineering team embarking on a multi-year journey to transform and migrate their platform to the cloud. We are looking for candidates with exceptional technical skills to enable the Digital Analytics team to migrate to the cloud faster and safer.

Key Responsibilities:

The successful candidates will be working on existing AWS cloud platform and managing it on day to day basis.

In addition to your strong technical capability you will be a proven team player, independent thinker and have a collaborative attitude towards your work and colleagues. you will also be responsible for:

Working in an agile environment, attending stand-ups, retros, planning, showcases and other agile meetings and ceremonies.
Collaborating with scrum masters, UI designers and dev team to determine platform requirements and priorities.
Resolving technical barriers and roadblocks impacting delivery teams.
Tracking delivery outcomes against key performance indicators and provide reporting to the Senior Data Engineers.
Designing and developing the code and structure for CI/CD enabling infrastructure as code.
Be a go to person for Developers for troubleshooting.
Designing and maintaining the Cloud environments.

What you will bring:

Strong experience with Python and SQL.
Experience using a tech stack of GIT, AWS, Jenkins.
Knowledge of Unix/Linux OS and knowledge of Kubernetes and container technologies.
You have demonstrable knowledge and experience with tools and techniques for analysis and data manipulation.
Documenting practices, solutions, known issues, and common trouble shooting procedures.
Strong interpersonal, written and oral communication skills.
Highly self-motivated and directed with keen attention to detail.
Excellent social and communication skills, “can do” attitude and excellent analytical skills.
Experience providing technical assistance and support to other team members.
1 – 3 years demonstrable experience in an analytics team.

Your new team:

We know that life’s about more than money. That’s why we’re so driven to do great things in the tech and digital space. We are rapidly building top-notch data and analytics platforms in the cloud, with a new culture and ways of working; adopting FinTech start-up mentality and financial innovation. We are working more agile than ever, so that we can deliver a great baking experience to our customers.

We're NAB:

We are proud to have dedicated $55 billion to help address climate change, be recognised as a Gold employer of LGBTI Inclusion by AWEI, endorsed as an employer for Women by Work180, have an African Australian Inclusion Program, Grad Programs, and Traineeship and Internship Programs. We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome diversity in the workplace.

The benefits:

From education and volunteer leave to learning benefits and banking discounts, we offer access to a wide range of employee benefits.

If you think this role is the right fit for you, we invite you to apply. Let’s have a serious but informal chat about who you are and what drives you. We’d love to share our vision for the future of banking.

To be eligible to apply, you must have Australian or New Zealand citizenship or permanent residency status. Please note candidate screening and interviews may be conducted prior to the closing date of the job advert."]

title: ['Fraud Analyst']
description:
['About the role
Our Fraud Analysts identify and assess fraud risks associated with new products and processes across Latitude Financial Services as well as the identification of improvement opportunities related to fraud.
You will be responsible for;
Assist in identifying areas of in-efficiency in the fraud department and work with relevant teams to ensure that improvements are made.
Ensure that fraud processes and policies are adhered to and that adequate monitoring is in place to identify any potential anomalies, including systems governance and internal fraud
Review functional and business specifications to ensure that any systems/process changes that may lead to a fraud impact are communicated
Conducting timely and articulate assessments of fraud risk associated with new projects/processes ensuring that business is aware and prepared for any changes that may impact fraud.
What will you be doing?
You will be driving and facilitating the continued optimisation of Fraud Prevention Systems by way of Rule reviews, Trend analysis and Customer & Fraudster Profiling. This role will also see you provide targeted commentary of Fraud Loss and Prevention results both internally and externally.
Monitor and communicate volume and quality metrics for operational fraud teams ensuring an effective outcome for the business.
Interpret data outputs of confirmed Fraud Incidents and translate these into prevention strategies.
Assist in the forecasting of fraud exposure and losses.
Assist in the implementation and analysis of new Fraud Prevention products as they become available.
Drive the communication of new/improved system and process strategies to wider fraud department.
About you
You are an experienced analyst who is passionate and interested in the financial crime industry, you understands not only who the "bad-guys" are but who are awesome customers are and how to best look after them.
Demonstrable experience with SAS, SQL or equivalent coding experience eg: Python, R
Ability to work in a dynamic environment where priorities can change frequently.
Ability to maintain high standards of accuracy and work under pressure to achieve deadlines.
Sound like you?

That’s a good sign! In return for your energy and ideas we offer genuine flexible family life / work balance e.g. adjusted days, hours. Health, well-being and social initiatives to help you feel great and connected, as well as our hugely popular extra week of leave program.


We always support a safe, healthy, engaging and productive working environment for all employees and workers, whether that be in your home an office or a combination of both. We live and breathe our values. Act Right, Show Care, Be Curious


Partners in money

Latitude may seem like the new kid on the block, but it’s taken us almost a hundred years to become an overnight success. Digital payments, cards, loans and insurance is what we offer - but what we really are is a platform that helps people shop and live better.


Successful applicants will be required to complete a background check (including criminal history and bankruptcy check) prior to commencement of employment. Only open to Australian or New Zealand Permanent Residents or Citizens']

title: ['Budget and Reporting Analyst']
description:
["
$86,558 to $98,210 (Plus Superannuation)
Ongoing
Usual hours of work: Full Time (flexibility may be available)
Usual work location: 1 Spring Street, Melbourne (flexibility may be available)

The position of Budget and Reporting Analyst forms a part of the Investment and Procurement Branch within the Corporate Services Group.
The Investment and Procurement Branch provides strategic advice and professional services to the business and our Ministers, creating value by improving performance and sustainability across the DJPR portfolios in line with its objectives.
The Budget and Reporting Analyst supports the implementation and uptake of the Oracle Cloud Financial System's Enterprise Performance Management Module (EMP) within the Department.
The Budget and Reporting Analyst will be responsible for building new management reports utilising EMP, developing and maintaining user guidance materials and providing tailored support and advice to end users to maximise benefits realised. The Budget and Reporting Analyst will also support the Manager EPM to review and enhance the EPM module and associated processes and policies, provide tools to enable informed decision making, and improve reporting and financial management capability across the department.
Reporting to the Manager, Enterprise Performance Management the key accountabilities of the role include:


Advance the implementation and uptake of the Enterprise Performance Management (EPM) module within the Department's Oracle Cloud System including by:
building new management reports utilising EMP;
developing and maintaining user guidance materials;
supporting the implementation of system updates.
Provide tailored support and advice to end users to maximise benefits realised from the EPM. Identify common issues and solutions and translate findings into new guidance materials, training and/or system refinements.
Support the Manager EPM to monitor the ongoing and emerging budgeting, reporting and forecasting requirements of the department and provide advice on the need for refinement of the EPM and/or department processes.
Demonstrate advanced financial expertise to routinely advise/explain complex concepts, ideas and issues to colleagues and managers.
Establish and maintain effective, strategic and collaborative relationships with stakeholders within the department in order to manage risks, resolve issues and drive improvement in budgeting, reporting and forecasting.

For a confidential discussion, please call Daniel Rodger, Director Strategy and Investment on 0428 039 561.
Successful candidates will be required to undergo a National Police Records Check prior to commencing employment with the Department
For further information on the position, please refer to the attached position description.
How to Apply
Please click the ‘Apply Now' button. As part of the application process, you will provide responses to the following two questions in your cover letter:


Give an example of how you've used your budgeting and financial analysis skills to either improve a process or financial system in order to facilitate budget and financial advice to management.
Please outline your experience in implementing a new system or process in the workplace; what approach did you take and how did you ensure acceptance from stakeholders.

Applications close at midnight on 2 December 2020"]

title: ['Test Analyst']
description:
["Job no: 495298
Work type: Permanent Full time
Location: Melbourne
Categories: Information Technology

Dedicated to delivering a superior experience to customers Hydro Tasmania is a successful, vibrant player in the energy industry and is Australia's largest producer of renewable energy. Continuing growth, excellent working conditions and career opportunities make Hydro Tasmania and its subsidiaries Momentum and Entura a great place to work.

About the role:

Reporting to the GM Retail IT, your role as the Test Analyst is to provide efficient and effective quality system testing to ensure business requirements are met, and systems adhere to all regulatory requirements. In this role will focus on quality/testing execution in line with the Quality Management strategy, including working towards test automation.

About you and your experience:

To be successful in this role you will be able to demonstrate your Technical capability in ISTQB Advanced Level Test Analyst/Technical Test Analyst (Preferred) as well as Demonstrated experience within a software test environment along with exposure to commercial development of software and experience in business focussed test environments and end-to-end IT applications testing

You will have a Tertiary qualifications in IT such as Software engineering and have experience with Salesforce and other Digital technologies, experience in working with Cloud infrastructure (AWS) and associated services and Extensive integration (testing) experience in a complex environment.

Application Instructions:

To apply for this position, attach your resume and cover letter detailing why you are the most suitable person for the role.

Applications close 5pm Wednesday 16th December 2020.
Advertised: 18 Nov 2020 AUS Eastern Daylight Time
Applications close: 16 Dec 2020 AUS Eastern Daylight Time"]

title: ['Reporting Analyst – Melbourne']
description:
['Req Number: KFINT15750

Location: Melbourne, Victoria

Posted: 11/17/2020

Category: SOLUTIONS

Job Type: Temporary

About Us
At Korn Ferry we are passionate about what we do, the value we bring to our clients and the careers we provide our people. We pride ourselves on high quality execution, encourage a culture of ongoing career development and recognise performance and commitment.

As the global industry leader in high-impact recruitment solutions, we offer fully customised, flexible services to help our clients meet their talent and recruitment needs. Our focus on unlocking IP, relationships within the broader Korn Ferry group, the calibre of people and delivering excellence, help us to provide a compelling and competitive proposition.

Korn Ferry provides its employees with a truly global opportunity to work with the best clients, as well as the best tools, technologies and expertise in the industry.
About the role
We have an exciting opportunity for a Reporting Analyst to join our Westpac RPO team. This is a permanent opportunity based in Melbourne.

This role will be responsible for building and supporting reporting development for our Westpac RPO solution. The role will entail producing reports and dashboards by utilizing Tableau and Microsoft Excel.

This is an excellent opportunity for someone with a passion for gathering information from various sources and tools, transforming the information and building reports and dashboards and effectively presenting to key stakeholders. The role offers the opportunity to expand their knowledge and exposure within Korn Ferry, working our new RPO client, Westpac.
About You
To be successful in this role, you will enjoy collaborating with teams across the business to seek information. You will enjoy working within a busy, fast-paced environment and will be action-oriented with have high levels of motivation. If you’re an expert at multitasking, working to tight timeframes and enjoy taking accountability for your work, then you will thrive in this role. Equally, you will be someone who deals well with ambiguity, isn’t afraid to try new things and has a solution focus to problem solving.
In addition, you will have:

two years’ experience working in a hands-on data or reporting role, ideally in the HR or recruiting space;
development experience building dashboards and visualisation solutions (preferably with Tableau, Oracle Recruitment Cloud and/or Taleo);
experience of data modelling techniques;
extensive Excel skills;
ideally client facing data storytelling and presentation experience

Apply
If you have a passion for delivering a world class RPO solution and want to be part of an ever-growing team then we would love to hear from you.
If you currently work for Korn Ferry or one of our affiliates, you must be eligible to apply for a different position within Korn Ferry to use the Careers Site. If you accept such a position, your benefits programs and Human Resources policies may change. Please consult with your HR contact for the new position concerning application eligibility, benefit programs, and HR policies applicable to that position.']

title: ['Business Analyst, Program Evolution']
description:
["
Footscray location, with initial working from home arrangement during pandemic
Full time contract until 30 June 2021
Circa $95k plus super
Applications close 2 December 2020

About State TrusteesWe are a state government owned company that plays an important role in building awareness and educating the community to protect the legacy and financial affairs of Victorians - we believe every Victorian deserves to live on, that's why we exist.
For more information about State Trustees and what we offer as an organisation, please visit www.statetrustees.com.au
About the TeamProgram Evolution is changing and evolving the way State Trustees does business to meet a COVID normal environment, leveraging new and different ways of working. You will be part of a small start-up team that is working on five key projects across the organisation.
About the RoleYou will work closely with the business and technical experts to help identify business problems, processes and solutions that align with the overall strategy, delivering a better customer experience.
As an effective communicator, you will play a key role in being an active listener, provide consultative advice to the business and use your technical and process expertise to identify opportunities in order to improve current process and procedures across the organisation.
Skills & Experience required


Relevant tertiary qualifications or equivalent experience
Extensive experience working as a Business Analyst in business improvement projects
Excellent stakeholder management skills
Excellent analytical, conceptual and problem-solving skills
Strong skills in process mapping and business process reengineering
Experience developing business requirements and business case development
Experience developing instructional and procedural documentation and presentations
Exposure to and knowledge of the preparation of project documentation
High level of competence with MS Office, MS Visio & MS Project
Excellent oral and written communication skills Desirable:
Project Management experience (in both IT and non-IT related projects)

Employee BenefitsOur people's wellbeing is important, and we are proud to offer the following benefits:


Career development
Health and well-being programs

Education assistance

Employee assistance program

You are not required to address any Key Selection Criteria an may skip this step in the application process.
We are an Equal Employment Opportunity employer committed to fairness, diversity and respect. As such, we will respond to requests for reasonable adjustments from applicants with disabilities.

title: ['Project Analyst']
description:
["At AIA, our vision is to help people live healthier, longer, better lives by encouraging them to make positive lifestyle changes one step at a time. Our firm belief is that by following our Operating Philosophy of doing the right thing, in the right way with the right people, the results will come. AIA Insurance for Life, Health and Wellbeing.
The Opportunity at AIA
As a Project Analyst you will be working on a Policy Administration system migration project including mapping all of the AS IS and TO BE process.
About the Opportunity with AIA
Working directly with the Project Manager you will be working within the BA Practice, assigned to one of our project streams and be responsible for the analysis activities on a couple of different projects. You will also be:
Running workshops, facilitate business discussions to elicit, analyse and create clear requirements documentation, including process mapping and a traceability matrix.
Driving required As-Is and To-Be analysis ultimately supporting the program and business in understanding and managing the impact of the planned separation and transformation changes
Communicating clearly both written and verbal with different stakeholders to successfully capture requirements and deliver change that supports the business’ strategy.
Providing support and guidance to technical teams to ensure the solution meets the needs of the business.
To be successful in this position, you will need to have:
Strong Process Analyst experience
Excellent Communication skills, you understand that interacting with people is one of the biggest parts of your day, and you build good relationships easily, with people in varying levels of seniority and functions within an organization.
Experience working with a wide variety of stakeholders gathering any AS IS process maps, producing both AS IS and TO BE process maps.
Ability to work on a more detailed process analysis and design where necessary
Strong leadership skills, are an influencer and build relationships
Life Insurance and/or Financial Services experience highly desirable
In return, AIA Australia offers you the opportunity to:
Take your career into a new area
Access our training and development to upgrade or build on your current skills
Make a difference in someone’s life every day
Work for a business helping millions of Australians every year
Access four (4) additional leave days a year to recharge and refresh yourself
Work in a business with no dress code
Enjoy wonderful internal Health and Well-being initiatives that support you
Work with supportive and inclusive people and managers
What’s next?
If you're passionate about making a difference, then click the ‘Apply now’ button!
Our in-house Talent team will review your interest and update you on your application, including adding you to our talent pipeline to jump you to the front of the queue for upcoming opportunities within our business.
Recruitment Agencies : Our Talent team does not require any recruitment agency support.
Interested Candidates : Apply using the ‘ Apply ’ button. No emailed applications accepted. For general enquiries only, contact:
Sirisha-S.Devarapalli@aia.com
Healthier, Longer, Better Lives

At AIA, wellbeing is at our core. We understand that healthy employees are happy employees. That’s why we have a culture of care that promotes wellbeing and flexibility, recharge days, flexible work arrangements and an AIA Vitality membership.


We focus on career development, people development and leadership capability, so that you’ll be nurtured and have every opportunity to reach your full potential.


We recognise your efforts and hard work because we understand that everyone in our AIA family is important. When people feel valued, they become more productive and satisfied, and we want you to feel inspired every day.


We are an equal opportunity employer that embraces and values diversity and inclusion in our workforce. We believe that for people to be their best selves at work, they must feel they can be themselves. We celebrate both our differences and similarities including how we dress, and we trust our employees to dress appropriately and comfortably for their day.
You must provide all requested information, including Personal Data, to be considered for this career opportunity. Failure to provide such information may influence the processing and outcome of your application. You are responsible for ensuring that the information you submit is accurate and up-to-date."]

title: ['Data Analyst']
description:
["Requisition Title -
Data Analyst
Job Number: - AUS121205
Description

Senior Data Analyst/Pricing Manager
Role Location: Melbourne
Role Type: Data Analyst permanent
At ANZ our purpose is to shape a world where people and communities thrive and to achieve this, we need a talented Senior Data Analyst to join our Payments and Merchant Tribe. The Payments and Merchant Tribe's mission is to enable customers to pay and get paid more simply, reliably and cost-effectively.
Our data analysts deeply understand the power of data to generate quality customer insights, manage information and identify trends to accelerate sound business decisions.
Your skillset will enable you to source and interrogate data, working with a focus on the future, with an active understanding of industry trends to ensure capability development is aligned. You will influence strategic direction by translating insights into practical business recommendations, communicating team objectives and presenting data in digestible, logical and compelling ways.
This is a critical role within Payments & Merchant Services Tribe will have key responsibilities including:
Analysis and implementation of pricing changes in-line with scheme mandates and other strategic initiatives.
Develop understanding of merchant acquiring pricing structures and landscape.
Development of forecasting reports, models and insights to demonstrate portfolio impact of various pricing strategy and changes.
Data analysis and insights development to support all other strategic pricing, merchant and BAU initiatives.
Design and development of capabilities and tools to support the tribe with data and insights to enable agile and rapid response to merchant and pricing initiatives.
Provide input and assist in systems design, development and testing for business initiatives.
Support and assist with data analysis and data extract requests across the tribe.
Promote portfolio pricing standards and pricing opportunities with stakeholders.

What will your day look like?
Analyse, review and implement pricing changes and ensuring the integrity and accuracy of data.
Leverage data sets and develop insights to support various merchant acquisition, attrition and pricing initiatives.
Ensuring adherence to ANZ legal, regulatory and other external compliance obligations through data and insights.
Supporting business initiatives by providing input and support to system design and testing.
Design and develop processes, tools and capabilities to mitigate and eliminate operational risks.
Presenting data and insights to the broader team and tribe to enable data-driven decision making.

What will be in your toolkit?
Advanced skills in SQL (Oracle PL/SQL, Teradata) and Excel
Strong communication skills and adept at providing insights in business-friendly language.
Domain experience in pricing and/or merchant acquiring preferable.
Familiarity with data visualisation/business intelligence tools (QlikSense) will be advantageous.
Demonstrate a strong sense of accountability and attention to detail in delivering the outcome required by business.
Ability to take a consultative approach in working with multiple stakeholders across various ANZ teams.

About ANZ
We’re reinventing the way we do banking, and our community of collaborative, innovative thinkers who create human centred solutions are helping us get there. We’re responding faster to changing customer requirements, focusing on the things that matter and helping people achieve incredible things – be it buying their home, building a business or saving for things big or small.
We support our people by providing a range of flexible working options so they can work in the way that best suits them. We encourage you to talk to us about your need for flexibility and any adjustments you may require to our recruitment process or the role itself.
We’ll also offer you the opportunity to develop your career, working in a diverse and inclusive workplace where the different backgrounds, perspectives and life experiences of our people are celebrated and create a great place to grow, thrive and belong.
Interested in joining us? Click Apply now, or visit www.anz.com/careers to find out more or view other opportunities.
Reference number: AUS121205

#GD 4.2"]

title: ['Data Insights Analyst']
description:
['Join the world leader in legal automation and legal innovation
Come help us challenge the status-quo
Simplify our metrics, help us dig into our data to deliver actionable insights


The Role:


The Data Insights Analyst manages and coordinates the activities to support data-driven decisions made by Plexus. You are the owner of the data layer ensuring the key metrics that drive growth are simple and that each team has access to these metrics on demand and has integrity.


You will have a passion and curiosity for developing, interpreting, and generating business insights to support the Plexus team in delivering 100% year on year growth.


You will work with teams to simplify the metrics and build beautiful visualizations of key metrics using Power BI and associated tools. As this is a new capability for the organisation you will need to drive the architecture of the data ecosystem and toolset selection.

In more detail you will:
Support the Plexus leaders to develop and simplify the key metrics that drive growth
Define the governance structure for data and work with stakeholders to define metrics and map business logic
Develop data models to report on key metrics to deliver insights and incorporate predictive analysis to support growth
Analyse data and provide internal and external customers with clearly communicated insights
Visualise beautiful dashboards using Power BI.
Think outside the current reporting and process. Leverage the existing or new tools to deliver innovative solutions
Create plans to extend and develop insights and observations. i.e. Challenge convention with data
Learn new methods, techniques and advocate for new tools and explain the benefits to the team / business
Desired Outcomes:
Create and manage a simple set of north star metrics for the business along with sub metrics for each team & product line
Create and manage our data governance framework incorporating data models with clear definitions agreed for each metric
Build beautiful reports/dashboards generated for Plexus and each of the teams
Establish a data partnering model with key stakeholders
Generate actionable insights and present to Senior Leadership Team
Create roadmap for data insights capability
Key Capabilities:
Build data models and reports
Experience in Power BI/Power Pivot
Visualization and storytelling skills
SAAS or Product business preferred
Data governance
Stakeholder management
Business Analysis
Best practice techniques
Core Attributes:
Curious
Storytelling
Pragmatic
Problem-solving ability
Systematic and logical
Passion for learning
Commercial acumen']

title: ['Service Desk Analyst']
['Analyst - Deloitte Managed Solutions']
description:
['Date: 10-Nov-2020

Location:
Melbourne, VIC, AU Sydney, NSW, AU Brisbane, QLD, AU

Department:Description:
Analyst

Multiple opportunities in our Managed Solutions team
Hybrid working environment across multiple locations.
Deloitte Flex - We recognise the importance of balance and embrace agility

What will your typical day look like?

Join our Deloitte Managed Solutions (DMS) team as we support our clients in responding to their most important and complex business needs, operating bespoke delivery programs with quality, speed and efficiency across a wide range of industries and sectors. No two days are the same but typical daily activities could include:

Provide operational support to business proposals and engagement activity across our existing or new clients in response to important and complex client issues.
Help lead the execution of our programs through structured problem solving, effective time management and providing our teams with the support and guidance needed to deliver high quality outcomes efficiently and effectively.
Providing project and client operational reporting, such as performance and status/forecast reporting.
Working in a fast-paced, target-driven environments, whilst maintaining composure in dealing with complex and challenging operational issues.
Support resourcing and operational requirements to scale-up our large-scale programs.
Thrive in a multi-disciplinary team environment and adopt different working styles to meet different approaches in our work
Involvement in the preparation of operational financial management tools and budgets.
Build authentic and trusted relationships with our teams and the broader Deloitte firm.

About the team

The financial services industry and other industries and sectors are facing significant headwinds responding to misconduct which has resulted in a loss of customer trust and reputational damage. Organisations have responded by setting up large scale remediation programs and at Deloitte, through our DMS practice, we support our clients in re-building trust and delivering confidence on issues that matter most.

Our vision is to assist our clients with important and complex issues and challenges: typically, in delivering large scale complex and bespoke delivery programs, often in short timescales, bringing our expertise and excellence in execution to help our clients respond to their issues, with quality, speed and efficiency.

Enough about us, let’s talk about you. You are someone with:
1 - 2 years financial services industry experience across any of the following: Retail Banking/Wholesale/Investments/Banking/ Insurance/Super/lending/credit or Public sector experience
A proven track record delivering or being involved in large-scale operational projects, investigations or remedial reviews;
Strong technical skills relating to process mapping, Excel, Visio and other operational I.T. skills
Effective communication and interpersonal skills
Enthusiasm and a passion to succeed
Experience of change management in terms of an operational context and an ability to work easily in a transitional period

Why Deloitte?

At Deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. We value difference and embrace people with diverse backgrounds and thinking styles. Knowing that people work best in different ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated.']

title: ['Analyst, Data Engineering']
description:
["Work type: Permanent Full time
Location: Aust - VIC Metro

A career that gives you more.

You will be joining a cohesive and collaborative engineering team embarking on a multi-year journey to transform and migrate their platform to the cloud. We are looking for candidates with exceptional technical skills to enable the Digital Analytics team to migrate to the cloud faster and safer.

Key Responsibilities:

The successful candidates will be working on existing AWS cloud platform and managing it on day to day basis.

In addition to your strong technical capability you will be a proven team player, independent thinker and have a collaborative attitude towards your work and colleagues. you will also be responsible for:

Working in an agile environment, attending stand-ups, retros, planning, showcases and other agile meetings and ceremonies.
Collaborating with scrum masters, UI designers and dev team to determine platform requirements and priorities.
Resolving technical barriers and roadblocks impacting delivery teams.
Tracking delivery outcomes against key performance indicators and provide reporting to the Senior Data Engineers.
Designing and developing the code and structure for CI/CD enabling infrastructure as code.
Be a go to person for Developers for troubleshooting.
Designing and maintaining the Cloud environments.

What you will bring:

Strong experience with Python and SQL.
Experience using a tech stack of GIT, AWS, Jenkins.
Knowledge of Unix/Linux OS and knowledge of Kubernetes and container technologies.
You have demonstrable knowledge and experience with tools and techniques for analysis and data manipulation.
Documenting practices, solutions, known issues, and common trouble shooting procedures.
Strong interpersonal, written and oral communication skills.
Highly self-motivated and directed with keen attention to detail.
Excellent social and communication skills, “can do” attitude and excellent analytical skills.
Experience providing technical assistance and support to other team members.
1 – 3 years demonstrable experience in an analytics team.

Your new team:

We know that life’s about more than money. That’s why we’re so driven to do great things in the tech and digital space. We are rapidly building top-notch data and analytics platforms in the cloud, with a new culture and ways of working; adopting FinTech start-up mentality and financial innovation. We are working more agile than ever, so that we can deliver a great baking experience to our customers.

We're NAB:

We are proud to have dedicated $55 billion to help address climate change, be recognised as a Gold employer of LGBTI Inclusion by AWEI, endorsed as an employer for Women by Work180, have an African Australian Inclusion Program, Grad Programs, and Traineeship and Internship Programs. We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome diversity in the workplace.

The benefits:

From education and volunteer leave to learning benefits and banking discounts, we offer access to a wide range of employee benefits.

If you think this role is the right fit for you, we invite you to apply. Let’s have a serious but informal chat about who you are and what drives you. We’d love to share our vision for the future of banking.

To be eligible to apply, you must have Australian or New Zealand citizenship or permanent residency status. Please note candidate screening and interviews may be conducted prior to the closing date of the job advert."]

title: ['Fraud Analyst']
description:
['About the role
Our Fraud Analysts identify and assess fraud risks associated with new products and processes across Latitude Financial Services as well as the identification of improvement opportunities related to fraud.
You will be responsible for;
Assist in identifying areas of in-efficiency in the fraud department and work with relevant teams to ensure that improvements are made.
Ensure that fraud processes and policies are adhered to and that adequate monitoring is in place to identify any potential anomalies, including systems governance and internal fraud
Review functional and business specifications to ensure that any systems/process changes that may lead to a fraud impact are communicated
Conducting timely and articulate assessments of fraud risk associated with new projects/processes ensuring that business is aware and prepared for any changes that may impact fraud.
What will you be doing?
You will be driving and facilitating the continued optimisation of Fraud Prevention Systems by way of Rule reviews, Trend analysis and Customer & Fraudster Profiling. This role will also see you provide targeted commentary of Fraud Loss and Prevention results both internally and externally.
Monitor and communicate volume and quality metrics for operational fraud teams ensuring an effective outcome for the business.
Interpret data outputs of confirmed Fraud Incidents and translate these into prevention strategies.
Assist in the forecasting of fraud exposure and losses.
Assist in the implementation and analysis of new Fraud Prevention products as they become available.
Drive the communication of new/improved system and process strategies to wider fraud department.
About you
You are an experienced analyst who is passionate and interested in the financial crime industry, you understands not only who the "bad-guys" are but who are awesome customers are and how to best look after them.
Demonstrable experience with SAS, SQL or equivalent coding experience eg: Python, R
Ability to work in a dynamic environment where priorities can change frequently.
Ability to maintain high standards of accuracy and work under pressure to achieve deadlines.
Sound like you?

That’s a good sign! In return for your energy and ideas we offer genuine flexible family life / work balance e.g. adjusted days, hours. Health, well-being and social initiatives to help you feel great and connected, as well as our hugely popular extra week of leave program.


We always support a safe, healthy, engaging and productive working environment for all employees and workers, whether that be in your home an office or a combination of both. We live and breathe our values. Act Right, Show Care, Be Curious


Partners in money

Latitude may seem like the new kid on the block, but it’s taken us almost a hundred years to become an overnight success. Digital payments, cards, loans and insurance is what we offer - but what we really are is a platform that helps people shop and live better.


Successful applicants will be required to complete a background check (including criminal history and bankruptcy check) prior to commencement of employment. Only open to Australian or New Zealand Permanent Residents or Citizens']

title: ['Budget and Reporting Analyst']
description:
["
$86,558 to $98,210 (Plus Superannuation)
Ongoing
Usual hours of work: Full Time (flexibility may be available)
Usual work location: 1 Spring Street, Melbourne (flexibility may be available)

The position of Budget and Reporting Analyst forms a part of the Investment and Procurement Branch within the Corporate Services Group.
The Investment and Procurement Branch provides strategic advice and professional services to the business and our Ministers, creating value by improving performance and sustainability across the DJPR portfolios in line with its objectives.
The Budget and Reporting Analyst supports the implementation and uptake of the Oracle Cloud Financial System's Enterprise Performance Management Module (EMP) within the Department.
The Budget and Reporting Analyst will be responsible for building new management reports utilising EMP, developing and maintaining user guidance materials and providing tailored support and advice to end users to maximise benefits realised. The Budget and Reporting Analyst will also support the Manager EPM to review and enhance the EPM module and associated processes and policies, provide tools to enable informed decision making, and improve reporting and financial management capability across the department.
Reporting to the Manager, Enterprise Performance Management the key accountabilities of the role include:


Advance the implementation and uptake of the Enterprise Performance Management (EPM) module within the Department's Oracle Cloud System including by:
building new management reports utilising EMP;
developing and maintaining user guidance materials;
supporting the implementation of system updates.
Provide tailored support and advice to end users to maximise benefits realised from the EPM. Identify common issues and solutions and translate findings into new guidance materials, training and/or system refinements.
Support the Manager EPM to monitor the ongoing and emerging budgeting, reporting and forecasting requirements of the department and provide advice on the need for refinement of the EPM and/or department processes.
Demonstrate advanced financial expertise to routinely advise/explain complex concepts, ideas and issues to colleagues and managers.
Establish and maintain effective, strategic and collaborative relationships with stakeholders within the department in order to manage risks, resolve issues and drive improvement in budgeting, reporting and forecasting.

For a confidential discussion, please call Daniel Rodger, Director Strategy and Investment on 0428 039 561.
Successful candidates will be required to undergo a National Police Records Check prior to commencing employment with the Department
For further information on the position, please refer to the attached position description.
How to Apply
Please click the ‘Apply Now' button. As part of the application process, you will provide responses to the following two questions in your cover letter:


Give an example of how you've used your budgeting and financial analysis skills to either improve a process or financial system in order to facilitate budget and financial advice to management.
Please outline your experience in implementing a new system or process in the workplace; what approach did you take and how did you ensure acceptance from stakeholders.

Applications close at midnight on 2 December 2020"]

title: ['Test Analyst']
description:
["Job no: 495298
Work type: Permanent Full time
Location: Melbourne
Categories: Information Technology

Dedicated to delivering a superior experience to customers Hydro Tasmania is a successful, vibrant player in the energy industry and is Australia's largest producer of renewable energy. Continuing growth, excellent working conditions and career opportunities make Hydro Tasmania and its subsidiaries Momentum and Entura a great place to work.

Reporting to the GM Retail IT, your role as the Test Analyst is to provide efficient and effective quality system testing to ensure business requirements are met, and systems adhere to all regulatory requirements. In this role will focus on quality/testing execution in line with the Quality Management strategy, including working towards test automation.

About you and your experience:

To be successful in this role you will be able to demonstrate your Technical capability in ISTQB Advanced Level Test Analyst/Technical Test Analyst (Preferred) as well as Demonstrated experience within a software test environment along with exposure to commercial development of software and experience in business focussed test environments and end-to-end IT applications testing

You will have a Tertiary qualifications in IT such as Software engineering and have experience with Salesforce and other Digital technologies, experience in working with Cloud infrastructure (AWS) and associated services and Extensive integration (testing) experience in a complex environment.

Employee BenefitsOur people's wellbeing is important, and we are proud to offer the following benefits:


Career development

title: ['Project Analyst']
description:
["At AIA, our vision is to help people live healthier, longer, better lives by encouraging them to make positive lifestyle changes one step at a time. Our firm belief is that by following our Operating Philosophy of doing the right thing, in the right way with the right people, the results will come. AIA Insurance for Life, Health and Wellbeing.
The Opportunity at AIA
As a Project Analyst you will be working on a Policy Administration system migration project including mapping all of the AS IS and TO BE process.
About the Opportunity with AIA
Working directly with the Project Manager you will be working within the BA Practice, assigned to one of our project streams and be responsible for the analysis activities on a couple of different projects. You will also be:
Running workshops, facilitate business discussions to elicit, analyse and create clear requirements documentation, including process mapping and a traceability matrix.
Driving required As-Is and To-Be analysis ultimately supporting the program and business in understanding and managing the impact of the planned separation and transformation changes
Communicating clearly both written and verbal with different stakeholders to successfully capture requirements and deliver change that supports the business’ strategy.
Providing support and guidance to technical teams to ensure the solution meets the needs of the business.
To be successful in this position, you will need to have:
Strong Process Analyst experience
Excellent Communication skills, you understand that interacting with people is one of the biggest parts of your day, and you build good relationships easily, with people in varying levels of seniority and functions within an organization.
Experience working with a wide variety of stakeholders gathering any AS IS process maps, producing both AS IS and TO BE process maps.
Ability to work on a more detailed process analysis and design where necessary
Strong leadership skills, are an influencer and build relationships
Life Insurance and/or Financial Services experience highly desirable
In return, AIA Australia offers you the opportunity to:
Take your career into a new area
Access our training and development to upgrade or build on your current skills
Make a difference in someone’s life every day
Work for a business helping millions of Australians every year
Access four (4) additional leave days a year to recharge and refresh yourself
Work in a business with no dress code
Enjoy wonderful internal Health and Well-being initiatives that support you
Work with supportive and inclusive people and managers
What’s next?
If you're passionate about making a difference, then click the ‘Apply now’ button!
Our in-house Talent team will review your interest and update you on your application, including adding you to our talent pipeline to jump you to the front of the queue for upcoming opportunities within our business.
Recruitment Agencies : Our Talent team does not require any recruitment agency support.
Interested Candidates : Apply using the ‘ Apply ’ button. No emailed applications accepted. For general enquiries only, contact:
Sirisha-S.Devarapalli@aia.com
Healthier, Longer, Better Lives

At AIA, wellbeing is at our core. We understand that healthy employees are happy employees. That’s why we have a culture of care that promotes wellbeing and flexibility, recharge days, flexible work arrangements and an AIA Vitality membership.


We focus on career development, people development and leadership capability, so that you’ll be nurtured and have every opportunity to reach your full potential.


We recognise your efforts and hard work because we understand that everyone in our AIA family is important. When people feel valued, they become more productive and satisfied, and we want you to feel inspired every day.


We are an equal opportunity employer that embraces and values diversity and inclusion in our workforce. We believe that for people to be their best selves at work, they must feel they can be themselves. We celebrate both our differences and similarities including how we dress, and we trust our employees to dress appropriately and comfortably for their day.
You must provide all requested information, including Personal Data, to be considered for this career opportunity. Failure to provide such information may influence the processing and outcome of your application. You are responsible for ensuring that the information you submit is accurate and up-to-date."]

The incumbent will be responsible for the day-to-day financial operations and the period-end financial activities, and work collaboratively with other members of the Finance team and project stakeholders to ensure the financial objectives of the Authority are achieved.

Equal opportunity employer
